If you've always liked decorating, I recommend this game! As a former habbo decorator, it just brings me so much nostalgia ! It's similar to unpacking but you can also customize some places so it's fun, very cute concept
Great organisation game with a fun amount of missions. If you want to decorate your own house you can spend ages getting items and doing that too.

I played for about four hours and I feel like I've barely made a dent in this game. If you rush through it and slap down whatever furniture you find then yes, you'll get through it quickly. But if you play it for all it's worth, including exploring the town, meeting characters, finding secrets, completing each job to 100%, you'll end up like me. It starts out playing a bit like Unpacking, placing furniture in a neat and tidy way. Then the story begins and you find yourself searching for hidden clues and secrets, finding hidden rooms and solving mysteries. There's even jobs where you can design your own room based on a clients needs. 

The art is top notch, and for someone with the eyesight of a bat, I'm incredibly grateful that hovering over each item gives it a description so I'm not staring at pixels unsure of what it is. The story is fun, the decorations are adorable and I love the diversity of jobs given. Top notch game.

I love this! I hope they add more expansions or levels. It's basically Unpacked but, way cooler. More items, more freedom, different games and styles and unlockables. I hope there's more and more and more and more, forever.

Absolutely love this game! It satisfies my need for pixel art, organizing, and story, without giving me a "this is such a chore" feeling. And if you love the sound of achievements popping, definitely play this lol so many achievements and almost all of them you can't miss.

I already have 23 hours of this game and can't see myself getting sick of it anytime soon. I read a review that claimed it had similar gameplay to Unpacking, and while that's very true, I find this game has 10x more to offer than what Unpacking ever did. Whisper of the House has all the freedom of creativity that I, personally, felt Unpacking heavily lacked. It's plot puts you in the perspective of a housekeeper that can clean, organize, and decorate the spaces your clients assign to you freely! Not to mention the detail of the decor is absolutely outstanding. If you're a huge fan of the Sims, House Flipper 1 or 2, or Stardew Valley, I highly recommend Whisper of the House! Little hint: there is far more than meets the eye to what seems like a typical decorating space game. I adore when wholesome games throw in a bit of something more eerie to keep the player invested, and Whisper of the House does exactly that! I'm incredibly excited to see what's in store for the future of this game!!

The layout of the quests are so satisfying, beautiful and chill! I'm not a fan of sandbox decorating games, so I'm loving the storyline of the game and the fact you are given specific items for the townies quests. 
I really appreciate the devs- you can tell this game was made with a lot of love! 
Also the mysterious town reminds me of the podcast Welcome to Nightvale. So good.

It's not often nowdays that I enjoy a game enough to 100% it and want to keep coming back to it past that, but Whisper of the House does just that. I love the decorating aspect so much, and seeing others screenshots or pictures online has me wanting to go back to jobs I had already finished to redo my decisions, which this game lets you do!!
the game is very enjoyable. its relaxing, keeps me engaged and wanting more, and the price doesnt feel too high. i also like the conspiracy nods. its worth playing overall

If you are considering buying this game I highly recommend it!! Very relaxing and if you like designing and cozy games- this is for you!! ALSO the game has a lot of cool achievements!!
An absolutely amazing game. Lovely pixel art, great character stories, puzzles, minigames and more! If you've been wanting to scratch your unpack and organize itch, this is the game for you!

I made it through to the credits and invested about 10 hours of gameplay cause I am meticulous with the types of games that allow me to decorate. I still don't have all of the achievements, but I would like to come back to it later and give it another try. If you like slightly spooky games that enable some OCD tendencies, this is the game for you.

Get this game if you love:
-Pixel Art
-Unpacking
-Point and click puzzles
-Rearranging stuffs
-Decorating rooms
-Patting cats in game

The main game is short. But the optional themed room quests is easily as enjoyable! Really love the art style!
Wish there's ways to categories the furniture & objects for easier sorting, instead of having to scroll through the whole list to place an object that I have in my mind. Hope that there's future updates to change the walls and floors!

This game is instantly addicting. Obviously inspired from Unpacking, but with a more interactive twist, world, & characters. However, it does have its quirks. 

The actual interface itself can be confusing and mildly frustrating. Sometimes you want to rotate something one other direction, but you can't. The customize / remodel tool that allows you to change furniture, walls, floor colors & styles is a major selling point I would love so much more if it worked better. 

If there's a way to change the colors on interactable kitchen counters... well I never found it. Things like the stove and sink just turn on when I try to customize, and who wants one or two pieces the wrong color? Not enough color options either. 

The UI is large, and disabling it is frustrating because it doesn't show you item names anymore, map to switch floors easier disapears, as well as storage and design tool. I need those up, everything else gone. 

However, the game is fun, addicting, and feels unique even though I've played similar games.
Just got the game. I was expecting Unpacked but got so much more.

Similar to unboxing, but this game has way more mechanics, furniture, customization, and quests. I've played the game for hours already and I haven't gotten to the end yet.

10/10 for people looking for a great decorating game!

A cute and fun game about unpacking, and organizing. Tons of items, Variety of locations and objectives, and an interesting hint of the paranormal. This game really surprised me with its scope and size, compared to similar type games of the genre. Very Enjoyable.

It's such a fun game! I've paid the same amount for games that have a quarter of the content of this one. It's a kind of love child between Unpacking and what Makeroom tried to be but with a story you play out with different characters and tons of mysteries/puzzles to solve. It's really cute, needs way more color options because while it shows you being able to change the color of items you very rarely can, but it's a really fun game and I've enjoyed it a lot!

This is the first time I sat down to fully complete a game on its launch day! I played the demo a few days ago and absolutely love the art style and the aesthetic of the game. I did not encounter any bugs and successfully completed all the tasks. This was an enjoyable game (I love the added mystery!). This is an adorable and cozy game.

There is only one thing I would point out. When using 'tab' to place items in the corner of fridges or storage spaces, you are unable to pick up the far left placed item. It only happened twice when I changed my mind on where I wanted to put an item, and when I tried to pick it back up, I was unable to select it.
i've enjoyed the game play and the pixel art very much. the coziness is chilling me. AND you may found a hidden additional quest is amazing.
Game is cute and a peaceful way to pass time. The mysteries you can find are interesting enough to draw you in! I think it's so fun.
great game! If you like Unpacking this is similar but with much more content

I've been super excited about this game for a while, and it delivers everything it promised and more!

WOH is genuinely one of the best unpacking / organizing games I've played. First of all, the world is really big, and there are tons of different stores / areas that you can organize. The art itself is really nice and cozy, and there is so much furniture, plants, rugs, and general stuff to unlock. There's also a lot of different areas and stores that you can unlock, so it never gets boring.

Players get the space to decorate their own areas freely, but also unpack furniture in other houses so the aesthetic is always changing. There's a central storyline, but you could totally run around and spend your time decorating if you wanted to. There are no penalties in the game, no time restrictions, generally no harsh rules on where you have to put things, and a lot a lot of areas. 

WORTH YOUR MONEY!

The gameplay is so smooth, the sounds are so satisfying, there's a lot of room for creativity with designing and, my favorite part? The story.

This is definitely a game that rewards you for paying attention. I could see myself having missed out on a LOT of little secrets if I wasn't paying super close attention to all of the item text, what items people have, what they say, etc. There's a genuine mystery about this game I want to solve and I'm loving every second of this journey.

If you like decorating/cleaning style games with lovely pixel style graphics and a fun atmosphere, this is a must get!

Super fun and cute game! 

Its got a very similar vibe to unpacking but there's more game time on this game compared. Unpacking had a fairly simple story line but they already mentioned they wouldn't be releasing anymore levels etc. 
This game has a lot more to the story line, added in quests to fulfil peoples requests on room designs, you can buy boxes to unlock all the furniture and all while following a fun creepy story on a problem everyone is experiencing. 

10/10 <3

i would say the only main issues i am having is not being able to search specific items when shopping or decorating as there isn't one when shopping but also the search doesn't work when filtering to decorate rooms
å¾ˆè§£å‹çš„è£…ä¿®å®¶æ”¿å°æ¸¸æˆï¼Œä½“é‡æœ‰ç‚¹å°ï¼ŒæœŸå¾…åç»­æ›´æ–°

Thus far, this game is absolutely everything that Unpacking could've been but even better! The style is amazing, you get to not only tidy up to your desire but you also get a pretty mysterious portion of the story through [spoiler] secret passages, occult items and there's even small references to movies (e.g The Ring) [/spoiler] which is absolutely amazing.

The content is good enough and worth every penny. Once you're done with the story mode you have quite a spacious map to walk around on a scavenger hunt. 10/10 for sure.

I got completely hooked on this game, I played the demo for many hours. What feels at first like just decorating and organizing turns into something deeper, with each home whispering its own little story. I love how free it feels. you can stack things in weird places, find random objects around town, and even stumble on spooky little secrets that make the world feel alive.
The cozy atmosphere is perfect, but at the same time it has this mysterious undertone that keeps me curious. Helping the villagers doesnâ€™t feel like chores, it feels like youâ€™re taking care of them in a very personal way.
If you liked Unpacking but wished for more freedom, exploration, and hidden lore, this game is 100% worth it.
ğŸŒ¸ Cozy, creative, and a little eerie in the best way. Highly recommend <3

9/10 ~! At first i thought that it's similar to unboxing but it has many more elements to the game. The interactions and some of the dialogues were quite nice. I appreciated that there's more than just unpacking stuff. nice graphic. decent background musics. some unexpected surprise is that sometimes there's chinese text instead of english? idk if it was meant to do that ^^''.
EXCELLENT! Scratches that exact itch. Tons of customization, tons of items, tons of level. Lots of secrets and the town feels alive.

I really enjoyed this game, it was giving all the right organising vibes (just like Unpacking, which I've been looking for similar games for a while now) with added mystery and story :) 

A nice cozy game all round :)

This game was PHENOMINAL... the puzzles, the hint of spookiness, the perfect cozy vibe!!!!


I will miss it so very much, and I hope and pray there will possibly be another game or an update

Very cute very nice. Tried the pirated version for an hour then bought the game :)

Edit: Finished the game and completed all the achievements. Overall a game with relatively short playtime (10-12 hours), but it is very entertaining and not like your run-of-the-mill house designer game. There's an underlying story line and multiple side quests that makes the game feel less monotonous. Every house has its own theme and palette. The 42 hidden pieces/cursed items incentivizes you the explore the map fully.

I have played a little bit and I'm really enjoying it! Definitely worth it if you are a fan of cosy games like Unpacking or House Flipper :)

Waiting for the moment this game goes viral because it's an absolute delight that more people need to be aware of. So many cool side stories and secrets, a vast amount of decorations and a charming little town with lots to do. Buy Whipser of the House! Don't even think about it!

There are too many items so every room is crowded and only half of it feels like it actually has a place. Especially in your home to start with where the furniture doesn't feel like it fits in the space. The bakery (2nd location) was terrible because it was so crowded and felt like a mess once everything was placed. Not satisfying at all and I'm not willing to go past the two hours to see if it gets better or stays frustrating at best.

Cozy game with some interesting dark elements that make an interesting story line for this little 'sleepy' town. The art style is super cute and the music is really peaceful. Great game to lose time in but it felt like there could be more content with how much it cost.
LOOOOVE THIS. Perfect cozy game for when you just want to detach yourself from reality and only worry about what color sofa matches the floor tiles super cute and slow game. full recommend.

unpacking on steroids! cute and whimsical story + you can collect lots of furnishings that you can alter/change the theme of for multiple houses of your own too. loaded with adorable achievements as well

Had a blast playing this game. Really reminded me of the game Unpacking but 100% extra content and game play time. So much more to do. Super super fun. Had a great time trying to solve the mysterious town problems as well. My first play though I clocked 50 hours. So I def will play again to get the rest of the remaining achievements. Oh and the price is more than fair for all that you get to do. A lot of time and effort went into making this game. You can tell that instantly with all the variety of furniture they made, the town is large, tons!!!

Very cozy cute and fun tidying/unpacking game yet thats not all to it. theres story and mystery that keeps you interested in the game. the reward also very fulfilling they give more than enough so you wont have to stress over what blindboxes to open first you can just go for it and there will be enough vouchers as the game progresses. everything is so well thought out. the price of the game is very much worth the contents. i havent finished the main story yet but i cant wait for more contents in the future!! definitely worth the wait! nothing but praises for this game. i heard theres bugs here and there but i personally havent run into any of them so far but i know the dev is working on it and actively seeking feedback im very glad how the game turns out so far!
p.s the game is so good that its the first ever game that i actually wrote a review of ğŸ˜­ğŸ’—

This game has so much potential but at the end I feel like it fell flat. I had so many unanswered questions about various characters and just the story in general, it sadly felt like more time was spent on making the game look aesthetically pleasing and they forgot to really get into the depth of the story. I would love if they updated the game with more content and specifically more story to really uncover the mystery behind the town

Whisper of the House is a cozy thriller game where you organise houses :) It was very fun, I enjoyed the soundtrack, as well as the sudden switch-ups in vibes.
When the demo came out it was much more eerie, but I think there was some type of controversy that put the developers under pressure which is why it's much less sinister as before. 
Overall it was a very fun game, but I do wish it had more character interaction and/or more sinister undertones. 
I completed the ending in 6.9 hours, and it isn't a very long game, so for $22 (AUD) dollars I would be a little more cautious when it comes to purchasing this game depending on your interests and what you enjoy gameplay-wise.

Very cute unpacking and organizing game with so much detail to stories. Unique puzzles and a town mystery to solve. Played this for over 40 hours. Finally finished the main story but I can keep unpacking and organizing to my hearts content thanks to the order board! Thanks for an adorable cozy game. My favorite part was the cemetery :)

A cute and cozy game with a suprisingly coherent and engaging plot. It was super easy to get into the game, to the point that I was suprised to see that I've already played 9h in total! It does have a tendency to freeze on the menue when you first start the game on PC, but ran very well on my steam deck.

Cute plot and just like Unpacking - super satisfying. Don't love the daily quests though but good for getting extra cash.

This might look like Unpacking but the only similarity is the fact that you're organizing someone's belongings (for a different person in each quest). The story doesn't have the same emotional depth, it's more about decoration, organization and uncovering the weird mysteries from the town.

I finished the game so I obviously enjoyed (some of) it, but I wouldn't recommend it for everyone. And the fact that I had to get so many achievements to be able to finish the story also left a sour taste.

Due to the cute pixel art, many might think this is a family-friendly game, [b]but that is NOT the case[/b]. There are some disturbing elements with the "secrets" within the game, for example as the protagonist you get some threatening letters, and in one of the first quests it is implied that [spoiler]the owner's dog is being drugged by a person secretly hiding in the house[/spoiler]. I don't think this is highlighted enough in the Steam page so I'm hoping this review will be helpful for awareness.

In general I liked the quests, but for a decoration game, it was really frustrating that the only house I could customize the walls and flooring was the first one you move in to, which is also the smallest. (apart from houses from quests)

In summary, this game did not live up to my expectations.
Super chill, fun to explore the town and find secrets. The perfect balance of direction and creative license.

Reviewing (mostly) every game (or DLC) in my library, part 383:

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â˜† (9/10)

[i]Whisper of the House [/i]is a much better [i]Unpacking[/i]â€”but with a mysterious, paranormal spin. Suddenly youâ€™re not just organizing a life, youâ€™re uncovering one. As a cozy, home-decor sim, it hits a sweet spot where every dusty corner, mismatched painting, and forgotten trinket feels like part of a secret waiting to breathe. Also, it came out on my birthday, so of course it's going to be great :P

ğŸšª[b] Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] Cozy decor meets haunting secrets. On surface duty, youâ€™re unpacking, placing furniture, helping clients move in or reorganize, and styling spaces. But thereâ€™s always a sense somethingâ€™s offâ€”hidden rooms, anomalies, whispers behind walls. That duality between comfort and unease is the gameâ€™s strongest trick. And then suddenly, you're investigating time travel portals, ghosts, and alien weirdness?!?! This game has more depth than you think.

[*]Creative freedom and satisfying aesthetic. This is the highlight of the game. The requirements are not as strict as in [i]Unpacking[/i]: most missions will let you put items anywhere. And let me tell you, there are so many items in the missions, and even more when you're decorating your (multiple!) houses. There has to be at least 1,000 items in the game. The pixel art is beautiful, as well. And so colorful! The pixel art is rich and textured, every lamp, plant, or shelf feels lovingly crafted. You can tell the difference between regular milk and strawberry milk.

[*]Charming characters and companion robot. Mark, your robot helper, is a delight. Their expressions, little moments of panic when you pick them up by mistakeâ€”those touches make the town feel alive. NPCs and clients are simple, but their quirks give personality to the spaces you inhabit, and their designs are very sweet. There's also a guide to everyone you meet, which is very appreciated.

[*]Ambient audio and soundtrack.The music is cozy, but with just enough wistful tension. It's charming for sure. Visuals and sound together make late-night decorating feel evocative. 

[*] Lots of fun and quick achievements that I don't think are missable.

[*] The UI (except for a little nitpick) is very good, especially when searching for items. You can sort by room or by function, and you can search things up by name. I wish, however, that the menus for searching items was bigger on the right side. 
[/list]

ğŸ“«[b] Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] My biggest con is that the description text over items is both extremely small and difficult to see. The text is black with a white outline, which creates a hazy effect behind the words. Sometimes the words blend in with the background. The text can def be bigger.

[*] Mechanics sometimes feel clunky. Rotation limitations (you sometimes can't rotate items fully), camera rules (you canâ€™t rotate rooms), and tight spaces might frustrate your interior ambitions. But for the most part, the game is very flexible. 

[*]Translation and dialogue roughness. A few lines feel awkward or stiltedâ€”likely due to localization. Some NPC or client text don't flow super cleanly.
[/list]

[h1]My New Favorite Cozy Game... Until It Very Much Wasn't[/h1]

So I picked up Whisper of the House on a whim because my brain needed a complete and total shut-down. I was looking for something with zero combat, zero complex puzzles, and 100% vibes. Let me tell you, for the first hour or so, this game delivered that in spades.

Right from the start, the graphics are just stunning. We're not talking hyper-realistic, next-gen craziness, but a beautiful, painterly art style that feels like stepping into a living watercolor. The house you explore is drenched in the golden hour glow of a late afternoon sun. You can see dust motes dancing in the light streaming through the bay windows, and the wood grain on the floors looks so detailed you can almost feel it. The textures on the plush armchairs, the worn leather of old books, the way the light catches the porcelain of a teacupâ€”itâ€™s all incredibly thoughtful and immersive. Itâ€™s the kind of game you play just to be in that space.

The gameplay is simple: you just wander through this empty, gorgeous house and interact with things. You can water the plants on the windowsill, which then seem to perk up and glow a little. You can put a record on the vintage player and this wonderfully soft, lo-fi soundtrack kicks in. Itâ€™s meditative. Thereâ€™s no goal, no timer. Youâ€™re justâ€¦ existing in this peaceful, quiet space. It was the perfect digital detox.

 If you're looking for a truly unique and atmospheric game that masterfully plays with tone, you have to try this

Read the full review with accompanying screenshots here:
https://playcritically.com/2025/09/07/whisper-of-the-house-review/

Whisper of the House is like its name: An inaudible sound, dismissed and forgotten as quickly as it is heard. Most of what is here is pilfered from other, better videogames, reused without intention or understanding. Its primary Housekeeping activity is a hollow imitator of Unpacking, devoid of heart and creativity. Its vague, adventure-style puzzles should be its most interesting feature, but the player character is given no compelling reason to seek them out. Iâ€™m determined to compliment at least one thing about Whisper of the House, and here it is: Its pixel art graphics are wonderful. The sheer number of objects available to place in houses feels like where the most care went into this videogameâ€™s creation. A videogame needs to do more than look nice to be appealing. At this, Whisper of the House fails in every corner of its beautiful city.

Very fun, casual play with some quests here and there and surprises. Very cute, asmr but short, however there's tons of hidden things to look for

This is a really cute and cozy game. It's very relaxing to play, and has some beautiful art direction, animation, and music. There are some wonky parts to it- it isn't the most intuitive thing to play (I had to use a walk-through because the game doesn't explain much to you), and it does have some English localization issues (I can understand everything as a native English speaker, but I did have to read some things a few times to understand what the game meant). Overall, though, it is a pretty enjoyable game that clearly had a lot of love poured into it. It's a decent investment if you're looking to play a relatively short game that has some chill post-game content. I managed to beat the game in about eight hours of laid-back play, but I can still continue to play and decorate little houses.

Adorable little game that you can 100% in about 7 hours.
Very similar to unpacking- organize and clean rooms around town to progress through the story. Little-to-no replayability for me, personally, unless they add content or update the game. As a standalone, short solo-player game, though, it's very cute and worth playing through once.
was in desperate need of a new cozy game that wasn't just repeating some old favorites. this is cute and fun, and sometimes a little creepy. thank u for saving me, i was so thirsty

There are a lot of items that are beautifully animated; makes it fun to interact with each object. The gacha elements to get various furniture also makes it more fun to collect them all. Some darker elements in the game were a bit unexpected, although they contribute to its uniqueness. In overall, a cute & cozy game to play & decorate to your heart's content!

Perfect, I have nothing to complain about, just one of my favorites games
Super cute game with a nice balance between interior decoration, item collecting, secret-hunting, and storyline!

I love this game so much! It's similar to Unpacking where you help people unpack, organize, and decorate. I love the pixel art style and the secrets you can find all over the town. The tiny cats you can pet are super cute too. Some of the town folks you help also have really interesting stories.
è¶…å¥½ç©ï¼å–œæ¬¢è£…ä¿®çš„æœ‰ç¦äº† å°±æ˜¯æµç¨‹å¤ªçŸ­äº† å¸Œæœ›åç»­èƒ½æ›´æ–°æ–°çš„åœ°å›¾

This game has everything I could ever want; a cozy soundtrack, adorable pixel graphics, easy chill game play with no time limits, and being able to design your own house with so many options and themes for furniture and decor. This game has it all with a slightly unsettling twist! I can't wait to keep playing and make so many cozy and perfect rooms!

I personally loved the game. The world feels really lively considering you can wander the streets, pet stray cats, pick up trash, and talk to people. Organizing rooms and enjoying the "spooky" anomalies was especially calming. The game motivates you to interact with the objects you are unpacking or organizing. That being said, it is not that hard to find the anomalies and such. Some may think that is a bad thing, but I believe the game is charming in that it is easy to do the task you set out to do and relax. If you are looking for a spooky game, Whisper of the House is not it. However, it is still enjoyable regardless. The game reminds me of the game "Unpacking" which I also enjoyed a ton!

Charming game with a gently spooky vibe. Very cute art, and decorating homes and learning the simple storylines is pretty fun. 
Not too long, either.

8.5/10
I like furnishing houses but my favourite was the alchemists place that we had to clean up and reorganize ğŸ¤¤
I do like the idea of the show rooms that have to be decorated but I'm not really creative enough for that. Finally, I do love opening mystery boxes but there needs to be an option to open like 5 or 10 at a time  cause it takes forever if you want to collect all the items
Jut an adorable, satisfying, and perfectly executed unpacking game. You won't regret it.

I absolutely LOVED the demo for this, and the game itself is so *chef's kiss*

If you loved playing decorating flash games, I highly recommend this. The little details really bring this game together (yes you can pet the cats!!!) the hidden story lines help make this deeper than what originally appears. Will probably play this game over and over.
Comprei achando que era um joguinho sobre limpar e decorar casinhas e acabei num culto de Eldritch Horror. E aÃ­ eu voltei a limpar e decorar casinhas. Absolutamente 10/10.

It's a very cute decorating game with some fun mystery twists here and there. The gameplay is pretty average of this type of game, if not a bit limited. The pixel art is amazing and very expressive. Overall, if you like a game where you decorate homes you'll most likely like it. If you like solving mysteries, you'll have fun with all the secrets the game holds.

A couple of things I didn't really like:
- The decorating feels kind of limited. You can't change the color of most items and the color selection is very limited, even with the color picker tool. You can't really mess with saturation all that much and some colors come out very bright or very dark.

- Almost all the bathrooms were absolutely tiny so you are very limited to how much detail you can put in them. You can't even change the shape of your bathroom and are stuck with the walk in shower set up.

-The ending felt a little disappointing but it does wrap everything up nicely. So it wasn't a bad ending just a bit anti-climatic.

*SPOILERS*


- The houses you get as rewards near the end of the game are basically just theme rooms and you can't change the wallpaper or flooring. Which I find very odd, since you given these homes and not like, reselling them/renting them out.
Such a good game, it reminded me a lot of unpacking but somehow better with a lot more options.
One of the best games ive played! Super fun and addictive! Just wish there were more levels...
This game is amazing. I really loved it and definitely makes my bi annual replay list.

A nice game where you can organise houses/rooms to your own choosing 
A few things that could be tweaked would be more option to rotate and customise objects
Great cozy and comfort game, not forcing you to rush anything just relax and enjoy the game while uncover some mysteries at the town
Really nice and cosy game, i really liked the decorating and cleaning but i love how the story goes and i was totally into looking for the artifact !

Great cozy game! Really relaxing music and gameplay loop, fun mechanics and if you  love interior decorating or tidying up, you'll love this! Will be back to play this when i need a cozy relaxing time!

Incredibly addicting and fun decorating/organizing game. You have quite a lot of freedom to place the items basically anywhere you want. The game on release had a wide variety of furniture and decor. I hope it keeps receiving updates! My only real complain is that there is no character customization and the gameplay gets extremely repetitive after you complete the main story line. The side jobs repeat frequently, it starts to feel like there is really nothing else to do. Overall it's great and definitely worth the $15. <3

I absolutely ADORE cozy games (and more so when they've got a little kick to them). Whisper of the House (WotH) is a charming and cute indie pixel art game where you work as an interior designer by helping clients settle in the town. But that aside, you also notice over time how some tidbits look and feel unusual and mysterious - creepy, even. 

Comparing this to Unpacking is a disservice to both games! While both are about making a home, WotH feels more free; in a sense that the player can place whatever they want wherever. Not only do you get to decorate people's houses as well, but also your own! It's an optional side that you can do with an extra feature of gacha on furniture by using "tickets" you get from completing missions and rummaging through trash (which is the best part of the game fr)

In comparison to Unpacking, WotH feels more episodic. It places value in each client's personal story through the way they want their home decorated in contrast to Unpacking where you only really look at only one person's life. Despite this difference, both games are outstanding in their own right and both WotH AND Unpacking are very deserving of praise for its cozy, comforting, and zen vibe.

Overall, this game is wonderful and if you're an avid cozy game enjoyer for room designing w really good graphic and visual design like me, you are sure to love experiencing this game as much as I did. Easiest 9/10!

A chill and charming game with fun little puzzles. The art and sound design really set a cozy yet mysterious tone. Itâ€™s cute on the surface but has moments that feel surprisingly unsettling in a good way.

The church in the graveyard honestly made me extremely anxious, but thatâ€™s part of what makes the game so engaging. It balances that uneasy atmosphere with moments of calm and curiosity, creating a really unique experience.

Overall, itâ€™s a relaxing game with just the right touch of mystery and eeriness. Perfect if you enjoy slow-paced exploration and light puzzle-solving with a slightly spooky twist!

Very cozy game about unpacking peoples belongings and placing them in their house.  4/5 would recommend if you are a fan of the graphics style, It can be fairly tedious at times though my love of organization gets its itch scratched with this one!
I absolutely loved this game! I'm looking forward to any updates and expansions for this game, or even an off shoot of it would be amazing. Hopefully we can adopts the town cats next time!
A cute, fast game but if you liked Unpacking or A Little to the Left, you will likely enjoy this game.
Did not expect this game to be this good. OMG, this game is addictive, 8.5 out of 10. The only thing that would make it better is to be longer with some randomized play so it never gets old.

LOVE this game. i fear Unpacking walked so this game could run. i adore the art style, the storylines, the characters. i would not change anything about this game, except possibly making it longer ;). i would buy a sequel in a heartbeat if one ever became available. 10/10.
such a relaxing, cozy game that isn't farming! loved the art style but wish it was longer
A fun, casual decor game with mystery element. Lovely artstyle and simple gameplay. My ONLY complaint is that the game is quite short.
I love how laid back this game is, and the art style is so cute too :D 10/10 will recommend

This is such a cute game for those who want isometric puzzles of clean up and design! It's so relaxing and a great motivator. It helps my brain get into organization mode in my own home -- not something I enjoy, but it must be done. It's also re-sparked the artist in me to make these isometric pieces! 

Yes, it is a short game, but it has replay ability. I haven't yet gone through the whole town and I certainly will be playing this again. 

Thank you Developer for this wonderfully cute game! I appreciate the time invested in this work and I really hope to see more!

Absolutely loved the demo and knew I had to buy it when it finally released!

Love the game so much! Will highly recommend it if you enjoy games like Unpacking and wish you could do the same for other NPC's and not just for the main character. There is such a variety in tasks you need to do (Decorate your own home / Unpack how you want / Unpack but the way I want you to / I have this idea with a few items and want you to add to it) which makes every task feel different! Not to mention the subtle storylines going on as well!

Only downside is that the main story with the pyramid feels a bit out of place? Might be cause it wasn't there during the demo, but the way it ties in to our experience felt a bit out of place (might just be me though, but I kind of thought there would be more to it based on how strange some of the 'glitch' interactions were).

I think we also get wayyyy too much vouchers for tasks (and too quickjly)! Let us grind and work for those furnishing pieces to decorate our homes! I do love that the gatcha furnishing stores prioritise giving you new items rather than copies of already-obtained versions (you can buy copies at the mall at least!) to ensure that you can unlock all items easier rather than it being a pure gatcha.

loved the game... i finished it too fast so im hoping they will be adding more content

So I got this game because one of the reviews said that people who enjoyed Unpacking would enjoy it. And oh boy, it did NOT disappoint. 

!!!MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD!!!

Take Unpacking, give it an entire town with a mildly disconcerting story line, NPCs with cryptic lines, news papers with eerie text, even a POCKET DIMENSION in a wizards house????? 

This game is fantastic and I've already played it for like almost 8 hours straight. 11/10 would recommend and worth the price.

Played this game for 6 hours straight -- super simple premise but each room is unique enough that game play doesn't get repetitive. There's also a good balance between the amount of "clutter" items and storage options that no room feels too cramped or full -- while also feeling lived in. I'd say the [spoiler]bakery and grocery stores[/spoiler] are the most difficult to keep from looking too cluttered but it adds to the fun imo.

I have been looking for cozy games to play that are relaxing but intriguing. I downloaded this game last night and played for over 4 hours into the wee hours of the morning (3 am lol). This game is amazingly put together. Along with satisfying organizational tasks/game play, there is an overarching story that I have barely scratched the surface of. So many things about this game are beautiful: the graphics, the sound track, the story so far. I am so happy I stumbled upon this game!

this is such a fun game!!!! it's such a good spin on decor/cleaning/organising games. it is pretty free to decorate however you want (usually) which is awesome. travelling the town freely is great. and the openness of quests are great too. nice
This game is soooo cute. I love the art style and the sounds the objects make.

This game was exactly what I wanted and then some. The two things that take this game from great to incredible are: 1) The open-world aspect filled with looting and bonus adventures, and 2) A rich storyline with comedy and mystery combined. They still nailed all of the basics too. The cozy unpacking and decorating gameplay is excellent. The furniture/decor collection progress is great, there is a broad range of decor types and level challenges to incentivize progress. At around 10 hours, I feel like I still have a lot of creative fun and exploration left and I can't wait to see where this game continues to go.

This is a lovely game that's fairly short. The dev team is still actively working on it and doing bug fixes so I won't mention the ones I've encountered as I'm sure they're already fixed. It has a tame but still present unnerving vibe(?) It's hard to explain and I don't think spooky really describes the feeling and atmosphere but I would describe it as mildly disturbing in the sense you might feel a tad uneasy. This feeling is very scant and only really ramps up in the latter end of the game and i enjoyed it as it adds a layer of suspense. That said, the ending feels accurate to the story's progression but it falls a bit flat. Just a tad underwhelming and the plot of the game is very minimal.

Despite the minimal plot, I enjoyed the overall game because I love organizing simulators and it's art style adds a fresh and exciting look to it compared to most other organization simulators (the only other organization game that ive played that has pixel art like whisper of the house is Unpacking by Witchbeam). I like the customization but i feel it could be more robust. All in all, it's a solid game it just might not be as polished as one may expect as the devs are still finding their footing for the game, but I don't mind that as the gameplay is the main draw for me and this game definitely has some replayability for me.

A very cute pixel organizing game similar to "Unpacking", albeit with a background Christian bent, where "Unpacking" was made by a Jewish developer and had Jewish elements (which is unfortunately rather unique in the video game space). That being said, "Whisper of the House" was a bit more enjoyable than "Unpacking" in some ways, in that the quests were quite fun, it didn't crash (though it had a number of lag issues that looked like near-crashes), and it identified objects for the player to move around. It's also a little longer and there's more stuff to do, although that made it a bit overwhelming at times, and I think the game is more targeted at people who like to make cute house designs than people who just like organizing things.

One of my main criticisms of "Unpacking" was that I didn't know what all the objects you handle were, so it was hard to figure out which room was the correct one for them. Although "Whisper of the House" generally sticks you in the right room for whatever object you're given (with the option of switching rooms as needed, though this is rarely necessary outside personal desire), the game also not only names whatever the object is, but also describes it. The descriptions aren't always useful, but the naming is.

There are issues with near-crashing: whenever a character would I think leave a screen, the screen would go entirely black, and the game would very obviously lag. During the end cutscene, the game froze, and then jumped a couple seconds forward. I also recall dealing with leg on clicking things at times (particularly with the gacha stuff), which was frustrating. While I appreciate the game is self-contained and has no microtransactions while containing gacha design elements, like games like "Vampire Survivors", I found this pretty aggravating because it does the "Kirby and the Forgotten Land" thing, where you can get repeat items rather than drawing from a narrower pool. This was irritating in "Astro Bot" as well, where you could spend hard-earned money to buy junk instead of items from the remaining pool. Considering just how many items there are in the game and how many pulls you have to do on average for them, it's very silly that you can collect things you already have when doing pulls, especially when it has no microtransactions so there's no intelligent reason to keep people making pulls, other than that's just how gacha tends to work.

The pixel art is very cute, and I appreciated the slight "Stardew Valley" and "Gravity Falls" vibes, with plenty of clear love for Studio Ghibli. The game does feel a bit overwhelming in moments, with a fast day-to-night cycle (that admittedly doesn't do anything other than matter for I think one item), and a small deluge of quests you get at once, until you discover everything is basically optional and the map has a pin system so you can set markers for yourself to go to if you get lost. The freedom and sense of narrative is nice, but I did appreciate "Unpacking"'s more linear narrative.

I was also really confused, from a narrative angle, why the game keeps giving you [spoiler]homes to live in. By the time the ending rolled around, I'd gotten a handful of places to live in, on top of living rent free(?) in two different apartments, so I was a bit confused why I was meant to be excited about being gifted a house and too much stuff to stick in it, cute as the furniture is[/spoiler]. This is why I pointed out that the game seems more geared towards folks who like rearranging pretty fake houses than folks who like organizing, because this game design aspects seems to be geared towards giving the former more of what they want. And that's great for the former, but a bit underwhelming if you're not as into that part and just want puzzle-solving. I'm also a bit disappointed [spoiler]we didn't get to have a pet. The mysterious dog is never explained, and we don't get to keep the cat(s) that are wandering around. But I did appreciate the aquarium[/spoiler]. Additionally, while the town is nice, [spoiler]it's mostly empty. So the town aspect (rather than just focused on building to building, as "Unpacking" does) felt a bit wasted, since most of the neat-looking buildings and areas aren't places you can visit[/spoiler]. I also wish there were more buildings with [spoiler]people showing you where to put things. I get it defeats the purpose for some stuff, but it was satisfying in its own way[/spoiler].

From a designer point, storage was also quite irritating. The [spoiler]present boxes are very cute, for instance, but you can neither store nor even trash them, so they just filled up my basement[/spoiler].

It was also very weird to find [spoiler]when you click the cop car, whoever's in it says "Comrade", like... the  pigs are communists? I'm so confused. I also wonder why a police station that serves no purpose (other than removing an unhoused person off-screen) was more important than other town facilities, like a dump or a school[/spoiler].

This can also be very hard on your hands, given some segments require continuous clicking. "Gemporium" actually had an accessibility feature for this, allowing a single button press to replace multiple ones. It was frustrating not to see that here.

Generally, though, it's a simple little game, with cute designs and fun puzzles. If you liked "Unpacking", you'll probably like this. If you liked this, you should try "Unpacking".

A nice cozy game that is reminiscent of Unpacking with a supernatural twist! I had a lot of fun with the exploration and decoration. The colors are so bright, and the music puts you at ease. 

Sometimes it can be hard to pick up items, and the "new item" notification can be annoying when you need to click in that area. I encountered no bugs, though. 

Thanks for a great game!

Such an adorable cosy organising game, I definitely had a fun time with it. If you have a lot of imagination, there's a lot of empty houses or requests you could even do after you are done with the story part of the game. I do wish the game had leaned more into the spooky mystery side, I was expecting more of it after the first mission with Luna and the hidden room, as well as the cryptic letters. But even without that spooky aspect, it is still a hard recommend, the style is very cute, lots of furniture for you to have fun with, and different type of missions and achievement for you to get. I hope they'll consider doing more of this type of games in the future, or maybe even DLCs with different parts of the town to unlock!
This game is SO fun, I cannot put it down lmaooo its very satisfying and I love the art <3 Play it!!

Was surprisingly fun, cute and would recommend. I enjoyed finding all the secrets, the mysterious aspects and decor and took my time. At a leisurely pace, took me 14.5 hours to finish the main game and collect all achievements.

Its unpacking but better. 
Why better? With Upacking i often felt the rooms were very packed with stuff, almost looking messy. Also i hated having restrictions where to place certain things.

Pros:
+ you have sooo much freedom upon decorating the rooms, i love it. You feel the bedroom would be so much better if used as living room and vice versa? Np, you can just swap stuff around as you wish
+ the furniture catalog is huge
+ you dont have to grind for anything, there are gamba lootboxes yes, but the game is pretty generous when it comes to unlocking new items, there wasn't a single item i had struggle to get
+ the achievemts are just the right mix of difficulty, while most are pretty easy and picked up along the way, for some you have to think a little further


Cons:
- i loved the little story aspect of the game, but i felt the ending was falling rather short and kinda leaves you hanging
- not all items can be turned 180Â°, especially bigger ones are often sadly only 90Â°,
- wish we could actually use the wigs and costumes we find and not only showcase them

Love playing this game after a stressful day of work. Its easy to play and understand. There are different themes and ways to play. Its not a linear story where you have to do one thing exactly right to get to the next part. I highly recommend if you enjoy games like unpacking, tiny bookshop, a little to the left and the sims.

super cozy gem, habbo vibes, short story with some mystery and puzzles but i enjoyed taking my time with it. afterwards you have the freedom to create many rooms/homes with everything unlocked, or take themed jobs if you don't have any ideas yourself. im just a slut for the pixel art. ill always have my eye on this game for more updates, more furniture & room layouts would be amazing and keep me coming back. definitely recommend :)
A cute, cozy unpacking game with a little bit of surrealism added in. It gave it a bit more of a plot than some other cozy games. Overall enjoyable and bite sized
OMG I LOVEEEEED this game! It is so charming and cozy while boasting undertones of horror/mystery??? I simply love it. Could not recommend this game enough.

This has to be the most fun I've had playing a game in awhile. The organization and art style is cozy while the story is simple but interesting!! It was the perfect balance for me and also I L O V E hidden achievements/ interactions. I couldn't stop playing. I highly recommend
I love the customization in this game, and the odd occult stuff here and there.. I couldn't peel myself away for hours!

I DEFINITELY recommend this game if you're looking for that Unpacking feeling - but I'll go even further and say: to me this game is better in so many ways. (but also very different and with a different purpose! not trying to say Unpacking isn't good, just stating my preference here!)

- First of all, the art is absolutely adorable and straight-up beautiful.
- You can walk around the map and interact with things in the city. It's so fun and the city isn't too big so it's not a bother to go from one place to another.
- You get requests from residents to clean or/and renovate their home or their work place, from duplex to bakery, flower shop, magic atelier... There's a good variety of places to decorate, you'll never get bored.
- There's no restriction when decorating, which means you place the items wherever you want!
- The stories of the residents are entertaining and cute. I wasn't expecting anything special but I was honestly surprised to find myself enjoying them and the humor of the game is all cute and giggles too.
- Daylies and side stories! And a newspaper system that gives you hints about them every day!
- There's mystery to solve in the story! It makes you want to discover more and gives the game a little more liveliness.
- There's a lot of items to unlock. The catalog of items is well-balanced. Having to buy them doesn't feel frustrating either because you get "money" pretty easily after a while anyway. If you like to 100% your games, don't worry, you'll be able to. Not too easily but not hard to achieve either!
- You get your own home to decorate as you wish, loved that part. And you don't HAVE to do it either, it doesn't change anything to the main story whether you do it or not so you can just skip it if you prefer to focus on the residents.
- You can enter any place you previously decorated and decorate it again. I never did it but I thought it nice.

Overall, I spent around 15-16 hours to complete the game and oh I wished it never ended! I absolutely loved it and I hope there'll be a new one, or at least a DLC.
I do think some details could've been better here and there (more variety in the OSTs and the ability to rotate all items 360Â°) but honestly, with the game being so good AND cheap, I'm not complaining about it at all. I honestly wasn't expecting that much content in the first place.

If you're hesitating to give it a try, please just go for it. This is easily one of the best decorating games ever! (at least to me :))

This is a really cozy organization and decorating game. I enjoy just how many items the game has to offer for decorating and how spacious the rooms feel. I think for it's price it's certainly worth it if you're wanting a cozy organization game, so I can't not recommend it.

However, I do have a few gripes about this game. First off, there's sort of a story happening, but it's rather unclear and the main quests I was getting through the mail just kind of stopped at some point without any fan fair or explanation as to why? I assume I just ran out of quests, but I would have thought it would be a little bit clearer about it, such as giving me end credits or saying it was the final quest. Maybe I'm not actually done, but I've spent another hour or so in the game and haven't gotten any more quests so I am unsure ahah. It seems weird to me to establish a system for playing the game and then abandon it. And the mystery is till pretty much unknown to me?

When it comes to the levels, I enjoyed them, tho some of the items seemed a bit too cluttery (leaving me a little stressed as to how/where I'm supposed to put some of them as a lot of the levels aren't given space for the clutter - such as one of the house levels gives you a bunch of kitchen items but there is only like 3 counter spaces and there aren't any drawers or shelves to put things into), or the levels seemed too structured, where they would just tell you where to put items or give you items that very clearly have set spots they would fit best, such as the shelves in the convenience store. I just would have liked to see a little more thought in some places to make it feel like we had more freedom.

I also don't enjoy that only some items are customizable color wise, and it's not clear which items are and are not until you put them down and try. For example, there are counters that you can change the color for, but the sink version of that counter can't be changed, so it won't match if you change the color. I would love some clarity in the game, maybe an icon or something next to the item that just says it's dyable. I think this is because the button to customize and the button to interact is the same, so for the sink when you interact it just turns the water on, but it's still a bit frustrating. 

There are a few other minor things that I didn't love about the game, and I will say that I am a little disappointed since everybody in the reviews has been raving about how good/interesting the story is and how fun the gameplay is, and I'm not sure it quite lives up to that, but it is a fun game and I'm hoping to play a bit more, in hopes of understanding the mystery/story. There are also a lot of things that I think this game does well!

This game is truly adorable and so charming. I love the art, storytelling, and overall vibe. If you liked Unpacking, you will love this!

At first glance, Whisper of the House is a cute game in which you navigate Whisper Town and help residents unpack homes and shops (and you can customize your own home as well). Yet there is more going on than initially meets the eye. The town is cursed. Someone is watching you. Locate and fix anomalies, and find out who's really in charge of Whisper Town.
I really enjoyed this game! It had some elements that reminded me of Unpacking, but I had a whole town to work with, and I loved decorating my home with items I collected along the way. A bit of a darker bend at times, but it lends just that little bit of mystery to an otherwise pretty chill game.
super comfy game mixing stardew valley type of visuals & small-town community with a hint of mystery but the main game mechanis is Unpacking. LOVE

Unpacking meets Welcome to Night Vale. A lot of cosy games are cosy activities happening in a cosy world, where bad things either don't occur or aren't occurring near you, but Whisper of the House is more sophisticated. Yes, you're helping people and tidying things up in a cute pixel world, but you'll finish decorating and step back outside into the pervading feeling that things are wrong, and most people can't see this, and only you can fix it. It's only very light supernatural horror but its inclusion really does elevate the game from a happy afternoon or two to something I'll keep thinking about for a good while.
a cosy organising game, i completed it and instantly wanted more

What an incredible game! 
I do not believe I have written a review before, but I couldn't help myself.
15 hours into this game and I feel like there is still so much more to do. I love myself a cozy game where you can just decorate and feel good and this game gives exactly that. I did not expect so much customization and details and it does go beyond the typical point and place. There is a mystery story to the game, homes to decorate freely as you please, plentiful catalog of items to select from and unique game play within the game play. I may be a bit sucked into the game right now.
My warning is to set time aside to play, because you might catch yourself playing for hours straight just arranging and decorating. I absolutely recommend to players that enjoyed "Animal Crossing", "Unpacking" "Disney Dreamlight Valley" or "Stardew Valley", as it carries different vibes from each game.

Absolutely lovely game! 

This game feels like Unpacking but on steroids. It has a nice storyline, the art is great, lots of styling options and extremely relaxing.

The difficulty is low as you are always able to turn back to places, get hints and know where to travel. 

If you liked Unpacking, you would certainly love this game.

I only wish Steamdeck optimization was better, as I am often balancing the controls of the deck and using the touch screen to progress or use the settings.

I was pretty apprehensive about this game. My expectations were linked to unpacking -- which I did enjoy but eventually found boring and quite short.

I felt a tad nervous starting this game and expecting to refund it -- worrying I was wasting my time, despite the recommendations. [i] I was SO wrong! [/i]

Yes you are unpacking people's houses, but they add amazing puzzles to keep it entertaining. There is a story where it actually caught me quite off guard and scared me a bit - LOL!

[b] Semi- Early Game Spoilers (not SUPER crazy spoilers - just fun to find/ figure out on your own) [/b]
[spoiler] What actually got me what the Alchemist house. Needing to find pages, herbs, and other items to make potions really caught my attention, leading to opening a hidden portal. Of course the hidden crack in the wall at Luma's scared the Sh*t out of me BAD, lol. [/spoiler]

Overall, if you like organizing, puzzles, and a bit of mystery - buy it! I spent so much time on it for the first run through, which is SO rare for me! I truly enjoyed this game a lot, and plan to keep playing, NO refund needed. ;)

A delight of a game! 

It feels like a mix between Unpacking and House Flipper thatâ€™s visually styled like Stardew (all of which I l o v e). 
Truly feels like a trap if this is your kinda game, you simply canâ€™t get out.. just one more task.. one more (until itâ€™s 4 a.m.). 
The game is really well made, the pixel art style is top-tier. Itâ€™s cozy and satisfying. 

The only 2 complaints I have are: 
1) As far as my research goes, thereâ€™s no option to change the layout of your houses, make them bigger and in some you canâ€™t even change the wallpaper which is a bit frustrating in a game that focuses on customization and decoration;
2) The story is short and feels a bit rushed. 

I feel like if the devs added more options for customization, added more furniture styles and expanded the story, that would truly be a game that many would come back to for years to come.

There is legitimately so much room here to expand and add new content that I truly wish they wonâ€™t let this opportunity to fizzle out.

This game scratches an itch I didn't even know I had. 

I love games with creative elements, especially when you have your own base or room to organize and design in some way. A lot of games have this now, but it's rarely ever part of the core game play. Then you have other games where creativity and design *are* part of the core game play, but those tend to feel more like casual sandboxes.

This game figured out how to do both in a way that feels like a creative sandbox that's also engaging and objective-based, with an intriguing mystery unfolding at the same time. One minute, you're cleaning and organizing a house for a new tenant. The next minute, you stumble upon a secret [spoiler] alchemy workshop where you learn how to mix a potion to traverse the astral plane into another dimension [/spoiler]. You know, standard decorating stuff. 

The library of items to decorate with is very large (much more than vanilla SIms these days). There are several themed sets that can all be mixed and matched to your hearts desire. You purchase items from shops via "mystery boxes" that contain a mix of common and rare items. So, it's a little tricky to get a full matching set right away, but you can recycle items you don't want for currency, and there are many ways to get more money to buy more stuff, or even to find new items out in the world. 

No objective is ever exactly the same. It's a very engaging experience. The world is immersive. The attention to detail is [chef's kiss]. The sound design and music are great. This game is a new favorite genre of mine, and it's in a league of it's own. I really hope they add to it with DLC or make a sequel in the future. For now, I'm enjoying the heck of this.

As others have said, this gives off very similar vibes to Unpacking. And it also adds additional elements and a story that make this game fun.
Don't expect this to be the best game ever - but for the price, it's a nice, chill way to unwind.

Game is super immersive, hopefully more content coming soon. Only got about 12 hours of game play and was wishing for more. Id pay good money for DLC. I enjoyed it very much.

75% decorating, 25% walking around and clicking on things. A couple of satisfying discoveries. One or two puzzles somewhat challenging puzzles. Mostly easy. Very light. Very short. Did I have fun? Yes, kinda. Is the game well done? Yes, it's charming and cozy. Will I remember this game 5 years from now? Not sure.

But most importantly, would I recommend this game? Yes, but not to everyone. If you want a challenge, don't buy it. If you want a chill sims-like game with a sprinkle of mystery, then go for it!

I'm so glad I found this little gem - what a fantastic and cosy play! The gorgeous pixel graphics are to die for, the world is charming, full and a genuine pleasure to explore. The decorating mechanics are deep and enchanting, with freedom of creativity as well as little puzzles to solve if you care to spend long enough digging around in each build. 

The collecting mechanics for furniture and items is intuitive and exciting, each time I unlock something new I can't wait to run back to one of my houses to redecorate around a new theme! The "jobs" are all unique and different in their own way too so that each build feels special and fresh, with so many different themes to explore. It feels really special to be able to walk into the shops you've helped design and then buy items from them too. The world feels so full and alive. 

The spooky/mystery undertone catches me off guard sometimes but honestly I would accept more of it, the cosiness of the game with the underlying hauntings is such a fun juxtaposition - I'm not quite finished with the game yet as far as I can tell I still have a few jobs to go - so I'm really excited to see what else there is to discover. I get genuinely a little freaked out at some parts (spoiler) like the spooky letters you get in the mail! But it's delightfully spooky in a sense that I want to receive more.

The devs also recently included an update that makes the UI of decorating so much easier by having the items easier to find in your storage/catalogue which honestly made it even more charming to play.

The one criticism I would have is that there's no way to customise your character past the two predetermined options - I would love to be able to wear the clothes that you can unlock or even just change the hair and skin tone would add so much to the game in my opinion!

However, that aside, this game is an easy 10/10 and I'm having so much fun with it. I will be devastated when I complete it. It's a gem!

So sad that I've finished this game. I waited so patiently after playing the demo and ended up wrapping up the game very quickly! I wish I had more gameplay that followed a story line as that is my preference but otherwise it was thoroughly enjoyable and you should try it too if you haven't already! Its probably the closest game I've found to unpacking and both are now some of my favorites.

Just a wonderful little game with so much heart and creativity put into it. I've been itching for another cozy interior design game ever since playing Unpacking, and this one caught me off guard with just how fun and charming and beautiful it is. I had an absolute blast, and I can't recommend it enough for folks who like this type of game. Just wonderful.
Super fun & cozy, an easy recommend to those who love decorating & pixel art.

Whisper of the House is such a cozy little gem. The cute game design immediately drew me in, and the combination of relaxing music and the gentle weather system makes it the kind of game you can unwind with after a long day. It really scratches that Unpacking itch, but with a touch of mystery layered in to keep things interesting.

The recent updates to the furniture UI are a huge improvement â€” browsing and selecting items feels way more efficient and user friendly now, which makes the whole decorating process even smoother and more enjoyable. The replayability is also surprisingly solid thanks to the daily showrooms, which are perfect for those moments when you just want that quick, satisfying â€œone roomâ€ hit without committing to a full session.

If youâ€™re looking for something wholesome, chill, and a little intriguing, Whisper of the House is absolutely worth your time.

ive been looking for a game like this for so long. tons of decor options, the ability to both freeball and follow a guide when decorating, cute sprites and awesome art, lots to explore (puzzles! and trash!!!), etc. etc. Might be one of my favorite games of the year so far. I'm addicted, I think.

An enthralling interactive decorating game with something strange going on in town...
Visual storytelling using descriptions of items as lore!

what a gem! this game ticks all the boxes- cute graphics, interesting story, lots of hidden stuffs/achievements to discover, really great for players who like to sort things in specific manners, it brings you calm and joy. it's great that you can revisit the places that you have decorated and still interact with it if you'd like to. there are also modes that allow you to place whatever you like with some base items to get you started.

I really enjoyed this game. My only complaint was that I was able to complete the ending before finding all the items so not sure if that is a bug or if it was supposed to be that way. The game is super cute, the puzzles are fun and I wish it was longer!

Whisper of the House is a fun decorating/organizing simulator that adds a lot of whimsy into a relaxing treasure of a game. The furniture is SO cute and I like that most of the time you have plenty of choice in how you create the rooms. It encourages exploration/curiosity as well with plenty of achievements to work towards and fun puzzles throughout. I loved Unpacking and this satisfies that same part of my brain that yearns to organize! 

A few things though- the story line is extremely disjointed. There are envelopes of special moments but nothing that created an entire package if that makes sense. The translations are kinda loose, sometimes conversations are nonsensical. The UI can confusing at times as well. One of the game tips that showed on a loading screen was to hide the UI when you take photos. I hid the UI and then couldn't figure out how to get it back effectively soft locking me from progressing. Someone in the Discord was kind enough to point out that the ESC key brings the settings back up, but that was not intuitive for me at all. The UI hides itself in camera mode anyway lol
 
Despite these issues, I have really enjoyed my time with Whisper of the House because the game mechanics and overall pacing were relaxing and satisfying. I don't regret purchasing it, have faith that the developers will continue to improve!

This game has a variety of home decor items and it was relaxing to put together the different houses and shops. The spooky elements were cute and fun to find. It was shorter than I was expecting, but worth the price.
Great little game, super cute and cosy with a fun story line and some interesting little puzzles along the way. Recommended. Will likely play through again.
i liked that its a super cute game! very laid back and the story is cute too!

If you're wondering if you should buy this game: Yes, you should!

Seriously. If you enjoy organizing and decorating, this game is for you. Plus, you can continue to endlessly decorate spaces (your own properties as well as themed showroom tasks) after the credits have rolled on the main story, which gives this game real lasting power over others in the genre.

Any future updates and/or DLC would be welcome, but merely icing on the cake as the game is worth every penny as it is currently.

Amazing! i finished the game over the course of 3 days because i couldn't stop playing it. i hope we get DLC's and or more quests.

This game was absolutely charming and made me have so many feels. If you like cozy games, this one is up your alley - of course, if you also like finding secrets and solving puzzles, then this will be up your alley, too! 

My only frustration came from not being able to get to one of the secrets until the very end - I'm staring at you, Crane - and also some that are such small details, I initially missed them on my first time completing tasks. Overall, this game is absolutely addictive and if you want to wrap the story up quickly AND you can figure out where all the secrets are, it should take less than 6 hours. If you're a completionist, getting all the items unlocked will take more time.

Great little game. The overall look and feel is so cozy and quaint. Some of the furniture organisation, variety, colour schemes and scaling needs work, but I've squeezed many hours out of this game and I can't wait for the next update.

I love all the little satisfying touches to the game, like picking up trash and petting the cats ^_^ These things make an already fun game that much more enjoyable!
Very cute. fun, and a cozy game, really love the "hidden" lore aspect!
Best cozy but slightly witchy and eerie game, with supreme organization satisfaction!

I liked the story, even though it wasn't as long as I wanted it to be. Regardless, there is enough other content for the game to last much longer! The decorating options are somewhat limited but the different items that ARE currently available are already good and can be used for all kinds of things! 

The controls are easy and you can keep doing tasks after you already finished with the main story!
I spend hours on decorating one of the homes and lost track of time doing it! Definitely worth the money!!

~Update at the End~

Fun story, fun mechanics, colorful characters, cute art style, hard to ask for more...
...
But I'm going to anyways.  Id love for this to have infinite play potential for me and if that's gunna happen I need more customization options and better item searching or sorting.  This game has brought me such peace these last few days I want to keep coming back.  If I'm gunna do that I need more color options for things as well as making the menus more intuitive.  I know those are big asks but it would mean the world to me if they happened
~!!!~
 Oh my god I feel so seen!!! everything I wanted, everything I asked for! it's all been added!!! and it looks like they are gunna keep putting out content which is amazing!!! I feel so blessed I can't wait to dive back into this game <3
Pretty cute organizing game! There were some things that bothered me (some things could open, but others could not, for instance) but overall a very relaxing, cute game!

Great game. I didn't run into any bugs or other issues some others have, so it was a very smooth experience for me. 
I loved all the small running plot lines, the anomalies, and the art. The small, more hidden stuff like Sparky and Agatha make me wonder if there will be DLC, and I hope there will be. Don't quite want to leave this game yet.

It's so beautiful and cosy, and I really enjoyed the storyline, but the game itself is broken. Without spoilers, a few of the critical quests make quite literally no sense (no guidance, journal entries or NPC hints). Hours of gameplay can be wasted due to opaque progression and terrible UX.

With that being said, my version of the game is bugged (I hate "cheating" but I was forced to check) as completing MULTIPLE specific quests does not trigger the necessary progression, or does not register as completed, which has ruined the experience. It is possible that the "impossible" quests / lack of guidance is also a bug. Maybe I just got unlucky as I would agree with the positive rating if the game worked. I've gotten a refund.

However, I feel that it is unacceptable for them to have sold this as a "finished" game when several elements are clearly half-baked and buggy. Others in online forums (Reddit etc.) have also reported this issue. I would avoid until the developers patch this, and provide proper guidance in the gameplay if that is not a bug. Overall, I am extremely irritated and disappointed.

Pros: beautiful pixel-style art and graphics, fun storyline.
Cons: game-breaking bugs, total lack of guidance in areas, and frustrating UX.

Update: I have changed my rating. The latest patch has fixed the bugs, though I stand by what I said about lack of guidance on critical quests. Overall, I enjoyed it.
Very relaxing and enjoyable game. The storyline is a bit weird, but I liked it anyway.
I love this game so much, only wish it was longer. I love the decorating feature along with the story line and hidden secrets. Already played it three times through. Highly recommend!

This game is very similar to Unpacking, but the focus is more on the decorating than the narrative.  I prefer a stronger narrative, but this game definitely has its moments too.  There's one level in particular that is particularly memorable.  

The decorating mechanic is fun.  Sometimes they break it up a little with various cleaning activities.  There's some small puzzles to solve.  I only have minor complaints about the searching and sorting features for storage items.  Otherwise, the core gameplay is solid.  I do wish it was a little longer.

I definitely recommend the game.  It's fun and cozy to play.  It's cool to decorate different set pieces, from houses to bakeries and beyond.

I've been dying for another game in the same vein as Unpacking and this scratches that itch really well while being its own distinct flavor of game.
Super creative organizational game, very cute, great puzzles
loooove this game, lot's to explore and the creators put much love to detail.

I liked this game a whole lot. I love all the options that you have for decorations in your own house, as you are really able to customize it to fit your likes and interests. The game play is simple yet lets you get really creative in how you want to design things.
Fun, satisfying, full if intrigue and lovely art. Highly recommend.

I'm almost done with this game and loved it. It is fun, cute and also has some mystery to it although I wished there was even more!. The only downside was not being able to rotate the rooms or certain objects but nothing too bad.

I actually found this game by chance when I was browsing on steam for cute, pretty 2D pixel games, and I saw that this game came out that day. How fortunate and I can't believe that this was not in my recommended queue. I find myself wanting to return to this game. It is very relaxing, almost aimless, but the tasks lead the context for the game. You're in a cute town and go around cleaning and organising. Very simple. Very calming and immensely pleasant. I really like this game and recommend it 100% if you like cute, simple cozy games with pretty visuals.

This is nearly everything I've ever wanted in a decoration game. The core gameplay is similar to Unpacked. Your robot buddy gives you items, and every item is a surprise! Using them to decorate spaces improves the lives of people all over Whisper. What I love most are the little mysteries that reveal themselves as you play. There are strange corrupted patches, missing people, extra people...a whole town lives and moves around you and as a newcomer you can learn more about it if you care to pay attention to it. I have not yet finished the game but I can't wait to play more. My wishes for this game are to be able to customize my player character, and that the fridge and oven in the bakery would allow you to put items in them. There are other fridges that can do this...why not that one? All in all this game is a little cozy, a little weird, and completely delightful. Pretty good music too!
amazing, beautiful, stunning. I absolutely love this game to bits. the combination of comfy and mystery to this game is just brilliant. I NEED MORE GAMES LIKE THIS :')))
