Loved this game and barely wanted to stop playing it. Sad that I managed to 100% it in 6 hours, and just complete the game in 4 hours, but I really enjoyed it and wish I could experience it all over again!!

This game is so addictive! If you like decorating games with a story (like Unpacking - but more so), you'll love this. There's a lot of secrets, things to interact with, collect, and of course decorate. Even after you finish the story, there's still more to collect and decorate with town requests at the board (unlocked as you progress). Thoroughly enjoyed finding all the secrets! 

My only criticism (which isn't really much of one) is that you can't dress up your character with the clothes and wigs collected. Would also be nice to go to some of the areas that are blocked off or unlock more buildings like the library. Maybe I missed it, or maybe it'll be in a future update/DLC. Either way, the game is still fantastic and worth the price.

i love the graphics and effects. It is fun organizing spaces and exploring the town. this is really cute and fun.

I have literally been searching for a game like this for years and Unpacking comes close, but this game takes it to a new level by being able to unlock furniture and customize your own places instead of ONLY moving people in and I absolutely adore it already. I honestly would expect this game to be 20 USD but 15 is amazing for this amount of content and customization.

I saw Gab Smolders playing this on YouTube and *immediately* bought it. It's so much fun, and I love the little spooky weird elements in it. I'm sure some people will understand me when I say this game scratches the itch to organize and rearrange furniture but without all the sweat, dust allergies, and muscle aches. :)

I found this very easy to play, even though it was the first time I used a keyboard and mouse for a game! So if I can do it, so can anyone else.

If you still aren't convinced: YOU CAN PET CATS! That alone made the purchase worth it for me.

An incredible charming game with decorating your own house, cute and cozy furniture, cozy soundtrack. I loved every second of this game! Very delightful game, hope they add more to it.

inevitably it'll always get compared to Unpacking though the stories/gameplay definitely vary wildly. much less a puzzle game with a subtle story and more of a freedom to decorate (most levels) and follow along with a more wordy sci-fi story. I do like that you get multiple locations to decorate as your own space. very cute!

the achievements are relatively easy to find if you follow the slight riddle in their descriptions. the only cons I have are that the gameplay levels just suddenly end with no real indication + some of the ui/translations are a bit rough around the edges but nothing that really sticks out. really wish it leaned more into [spoiler]the slight "spooky" side it had going - primarily at the haunted tower and the hidden room! - as this would have been pretty unique in this type of game :D[/spoiler]

all in all, pretty cute! good to wait for a sale as it only takes around >8hrs to finish depending on how much you explore/[spoiler]notice the anomalies[/spoiler].
Super cute game. easy and cozy. reminds me of unpacking.

it is very relaxing and similar to unpacking game play and stardew valley with graphics, i just wish there was a bit more to do, however the game did just come out not to long ago. It is a very relaxing game and i can't wait to see more from the developers!!!

Very cute game! I found myself spending more time than needed organizing things that didn't need to be organized. I enjoy the slightly creepy/unsettling nature of the story. It's reminiscent of the world of Night Vale, where things are just slightly "off". The vibes are perfection!
BRILLIANT! Needed something to hold attention and this does, the satisfy creativity alongside the small puzzles and mystery are wonderfully combined to create the perfect game.
adorable, only a few hours in but perfect if you want a cute and chill housing game (with some mysteries too apparently!)

The concept of this game is simple, but it's been incredibly well executed and there are so many details to discover! It's nice to see modern games utilising isometric pixel for their graphics too, it's got real charm to it and all the assets in the game look wonderful. :)

its a lovely game, cute art, chilling vibes, relaxing, but i was sad that i was able to finish the game earlier than i expected.

would recommend it :)
I like the concept of the game, I hope a new chapter is coming.

Such an adorable little game that had me in a choke hold for over a week!
I found myself gravitating towards this game, primarily for the cosy atmosphere and incredible customisation. The story was a huge surprise for me as well, although i wish some characters got more screen time. 

Additionally, I wish the notice board quests let me decorate multiple buildings across the map rather than being limited to  one, and I also often wanted to view certain rooms from different angles, but after searching for controls to do so, I eventually realised it wasnâ€™t possible.

Overall I love it and i will certainly be coming back when more updates are made! :)
This game is very enjoyable, been unwinding from tough work to play some cozy game and 10/10 this game is super relaxing and enjoyable. Highly recommend

Such a cute and relaxing game. I've been playing it for two days and I have been loving every second of it. It has a cool mystery that I'm trying to unravel as I explore this beautiful world!!! 

10/10 Will play again once I've finished my first playthrough haha.

It's a chill game, if your favorite part of every game is the interior design aspect, this is the perfect game for you! I liked it, it had some fun story telling parts and some pretty interior furniture to decorate with - even after the game, you can still enjoy decorating everything to your taste, there are even presets in your house so you can decorate in different ways <3

Iâ€™m a big fan of decorating and room-arranging games, and if you enjoy that style too, youâ€™ll probably love Whisper of the House. Each stage feels fresh with slightly different mechanics and its own little storyline. Some of the furniture is interactive, and you can even change the colors of walls and furniture. You can really feel the amount of love and detail that went into making this game.

This was a very enjoyable, fun, and well designed game! The art style is Lovely and very sweet, and there's just enough weirdness added to be very fun and curious! If you enjoy decorating and organizing, as well as solving small mysteries while exploring a lil town, you will most likely enjoy this game.

Super duper cute and fun--if you liked Unpacking, this game has a really similar vibe. My favorite levels were honestly the ones where they told us where everything was supposed to go, I really enjoyed watching the room come together! (I've always been bad at sandbox style games). Finding the anomalies was also fun. Definitely worth the few hours I spent!

very cute and chill, but not just aonother room decorator sim! couple buggs nedd fixing but nothing stopping gameplay, and there is a bit of replayebility after story mode ends wich is nice! I loved the character stories and easter eggs

Beautiful art and fun gameplay ğŸ˜Œ The devs clearly put a lot of thought and effort into making the whole experience enjoyable. Lots of quality of life features too like a toggle to highlight misplaced items and a search for your storage. Sound design is great and full of cute nuances. And the localisation is excellent. 

I wish there was full controller support so it could be played more easily on a handheld, but it plays very well on mouse and kbd.

This game totally scratched my unpacking itch! Super chill and cozy and the story lines are also pretty sweet. Completed the game to perfection, but took my time. Would totally recommend this to anyone looking for a binge cozy play sesh or for someone who wants to jump in here and there. Loved it!

Whisper of the House is more immersive than most "organization" games; the stories are cute, and finding the secrets is a huge part of the fun. I like the open exploration and the collectibles throughout the map. 

I look forward to seeing more from these devs. This game is 100% worth the price, and a perfect choice if you are looking for a casual experience with some light puzzles!

If you love to organize and want a cute, cozy game with a flare of mystery, this is the game for you. This game is about organizing different homes and business for people around the town you just moved to. The pixel artstyle and lofi-esq music give the game a cozy vibe. There is also a mystery to the town which is slowly revealed as you talk to more people in town and receive newspaper with hints to what is going on. It reminds me of Unpacking but expanded to the city and it's people.
Charming graphics, immersive sound design, and intricate mechanics!

I loved playing this game! It is super cozy and sooo satisfying! I petted every cat I saw.

The side missions are great! They really allow you to use your creativity and go crazy with the amount of clutter! Especially sinceyou have access to all of the objects you unlocked/discovered.

It does have its limitations. When you get to the end, getting vouchers is... Well, a bit of a chore. I didn't have enough to be able to furnish all of my houses how I wanted.

The coziest, most intriguing game I've played in a while! Loved all the detail put into this game.
Super cute and cozy. If you loved the game Unpacking, but wished there was more variety and more to do at the end, this is the game for you.

AMAZING GAMEPLAY. I feel the ending was anti climactic but you really get a sense of all the characters and start to feel you belong in town, wish the game was longer i was surprised when i had finished ):
Absolutely adoring this game so far; it's relaxing and has a sense of mystery about it and a cute story that keeps me coming back. Highly recommend.

Sadly it's a very short game. I love the graphics on this game. 
If you love the game Unpacking then you'll love this game.
Fun, witchy, and comfy game play.
I'd rate the game a solid eight out of ten.

I really loved the little lore bits, it's not just an organization or decoration game, there are unique characters with funny quirks and the little secret unlocks make it really fun! I found myself actually wanting to decorate rather than just speed through it all.
Definitely beautiful and funny, after 10 hours of playing and enjoying it..i love it. Hope one day we could have more games like this

Do you like petting cats?
Do you like arranging furniture and designing spaces?
Do you like solving fun puzzles?
Do you like uncursing items and solving the mystery of this town?

Then this is the game for you. It's a fun cozy story with some interesting elements. You get to design spaces and help out the towns people. It's super relaxing and enjoyable. No horror but there is some super natural stuff. Enough weird things to keep you interested. You can also pet the cats. 10/10 absolutely loved this game and will continue to play it even though I've finished it. I'm hoping there will be a dlc for it in the future.

Very cute game with lots of options for putting your own creative spark into your house and those of your clients. Only annoyance is that the UI can be a little confusing, specifically in knowing what you're picking up and where you're putting it. A good game for a rainy day with tea beside you and a purring cat on your lap.

It like if Unpacking and Stardew Valley had a baby, and that baby grew up with an obsession for cleaning and interior decorating. Very fun and cute little game with beautiful pixel art. Isn't hard to 100% percent at all and offers enough content to keep you busy for a decent while. 
That being said, I think 15 dollars is a little much for it, I'd wait for a sale. There isn't much replayability outside of a (kinda) sandbox mode. It's the same game every time, with little to no variation on it depending if you choose to do certain tasks or not.

It has the subtle storytelling and item sorting elements of Unpacking, plus light puzzle-solving, exploration, item collection, gacha, free decorating and more. And itâ€™s all wrapped up in super cute pixel art with a nice soundtrack. 

Wonderful game! I highly recommend it.

Cute, fun, with neat little puzzles tucked inside this organization, cozy, sim game. The underlying story is quirky and adds a little something extra to an otherwise easy-going, adorable game. I loved styling rooms to my preference, and unlocking different items to design rooms with. 

I will say there was about 11 hours of content for me, but at $20 it is reasonable. I have gotten more playtime out of other games for the same price point but it really is a fun and adorable way to decompress and burn off some time.

This super cute and spooky cleaning game is so nice to destress and focussing on making the area and layout of each place cute. I enjoy going back into places I have worked on to reorganize as needed and enjoy cleaning up the map. Fun little story line as well and getting to customize my own space is my absolute favorite feature.
A super cozy, satisfying decorating game â€” perfect if you liked Unpacking. The vibe is chill, the art is charming, and there are little secrets hidden around the town that keep things interesting.

Very cozy and cute game about unpacking, decorating and helping out the townspeople, with little spooky things tucked away all over town. The stories are all really well done, and I really loved the one with the scientist and the grandpa, as well as the one with the gang boss leader. The spooks are fun to find and get pretty scary at times (like finding that room in the first mission, or the cemetery tower), but thankfully no jumpscares. Absolutely stellar game that I'm glad to have played and discover all achievements for.

In the future, I would love to see furniture recoloring options, more spooky anomalies, even more furniture types, and maybe some more achievements to get. Glad to hear that a house purchasing option is in the works soon, so looking forward to that, and hopefully there will be a way to customize and construct/deconstruct room types too!

Really cute game with spooky elements. Love the animation style too and the variety of items to decorate with. LOTS of shiba - excellent choice. Definitely exceeded expectations, but admittedly I completed it quite quickly - I know there are extra 'jobs' for you to do, but I would love a DLC or even a second game that's a bit longer, or even the opportunity to travel outside of the immediate town.

As a lover of character creation, I would have loved to have a few choices on your character's appearance (other than gender), but that's not the end of the world. The game is still really cute and fun without it. More please! :)

Estava precisando de um joguinho tranquilo para relaxar e esse jogo cumpre com o prometido. Espero que saia novas expansÃµes logo, pois achei o jogo curto e queria jogar mais

I love Unpacking and have played it at least 5 times through since its release. This game really scratched the itch for new content in that game. If you loved unpacking, you'll love this one as well. There is also a mystery/spooky element as well.
some ui is very annoying to use with controller but i stuck it thru cause the game is so much fun and super unique
Was getting bored of House Flipper, Crime Scene Cleaner, and this game sucked me in for about 6 hours straight; no regrets.

Super cozy and lovely game. Its similar to Unpacking but gives you an adorable world to run around in. Bonus points for there being kitties you can pet. The mystery and clues are easy but still fun to solve. You can also continue playing and decorating after the story is complete. 5/5 paws.

â­ Whisper of the House â€“ Cozy with a Hint of Mystery â­

Whisper of the House is a surprisingly relaxing and cozy experience with just the right touch of mystery. You play as a housekeeper whoâ€™s new in town, working for a company that helps residents move into their homes and gets local shops set up. Along the way, youâ€™ll be cleaning, organizing, and fixing up the townâ€”everything from tidying up trash to repairing objects that are mysteriously â€œglitched.â€

What really stood out to me is how the game balances cozy, laid-back gameplay with a storyline that hints at something deeper. The town feels warm and inviting, but thereâ€™s also this subtle haunted vibe that makes you want to keep exploring and see whatâ€™s really going on behind the scenes.

Itâ€™s the kind of game you can unwind withâ€”whether youâ€™re completing small tasks, wandering the streets, or piecing together the story. If you enjoy cozy sims, light puzzle-solving, and a dash of supernatural mystery, this is a wonderful little gem worth picking up.

This game was great! A nice game with a lot of potential. I'd say a playthrough was probably 7-8 hours for me? The different puzzles were fun and I kept coming back excited to continue. Whisper in the House plays a bit to the organizing itch, but also to simple puzzle solving. I'm playing it again now to connect more of the story for myself. Well worth the purchase.

A lot of fun! A lot is still missing, there are obviously areas to expand in the world. But it's still worth playing if you want to dive in now.
The team is very responsive regarding bug reports.

It's a very cute game until you encounter that first fucked up thing. I'm hooked. So much hidden lore! So many sneaky puzzles!
Go play it and find out for yourself!

A nice quiet cozy game with an enjoyable soundtrack, WOFTH offers an enjoyable story line based around the core mechanic of decorating, sprinkled varying tasks to drive the story, and hidden anomalies/puzzles to solve, this game is short and sweet with an expected endgame/replay. While somewhat repetitive, there's promising room for updates, DLC/expansions, and improvement.

A few points of improvement
1) furniture rotation - many items are locked to only 2 positions (as noted above, limiting their aesthetic use)
2) better/more inclusive customization of furniture - very few offer the color change option
3) better/more wall, floor, and railing options (renovation)

In the future, it'd be nice to have the ability to chose house layouts or at least move stairs/lofts to create a better sandbox experience. Overall I give this game an 8/10 - it's just the beginning, and I hope to see more!
This is a great little game with a surprising amount of content. The game play is so satisfying, it scratches that itch and the art style is very adorable.

This game is VERY cozy, but with a twist, encouraging you to find more and more secrets about the apparently normal town you moved to. 
I loved playing it and trying to find as many secrets as possible and solving every puzzle. Would highly recommend if you like to decorate and sort stuff but other games in this field bore you.

Its a solid mix between animal crossing and unpacking with a little twist of strange and unusual. It kept making me wanting to come back and find more secrets- great game and very relaxing.

This game is so cute and charming! Ive really enjoyed playing it even though the game loop is kind of short. I ran into a few bugs but not bad enough to make me regret having and playing the game. Im keen for a patch or two to add a little more story so I can access some of the locked out area's

Ever since the demo was released, I was looking forward to this game and I feel like it has lived up to my expectations. It does have a similar style to 'Unpacking' when it comes to cleaning and organizing but the story and the mystery pushed me to keep playing it until the end. I did see the dev say that they plan to update with more stories to add onto this game in the future, so I'm looking forward to that. ^^

Super cute and fun game! you basically decorate houses just like in unpacking, but with this one it has a wide range of fun storys for you to fallow with lots of levels to complete and loads of kittens to pat. i love the attention to detail in this as every single pixel item has either a fun description or some sort of animation. this game is very free form and despite the loot box mechanic it is very easy to 100% your furniture cataloge.

A fun little game to relax and unwind, if unpacking or decorating games are your thing. Love the sprinkle off oddities and mystery scattered throughout and the variety in jobs. Some unpacking and decorating, just some cleaning and others a mixture of both. Getting a couple of your own houses to decorate with blind box purchase at stores around town is also great, I just wish you could change wall and floor styles and colour on all rooms in all houses. But that's just my own nit-pick. Otherwise really enjoying the game.

Great chill and cozy vibe with an interesting story. I found myself really immersed in it, but I do wish it had been a bit longer. Still, itâ€™s definitely worth playing for anyone looking for a relaxing experience with a compelling narrative.
Amazing little game! very much inlove with the artstyle and gameplay so far! really reccomend if you loved unpacking!

This game is absolutely a brilliant game! If you love the game Unpacking, you'll absolutely love this game. I love how much freedom you have to decorate in most scenarios. Definitely worth the $15
A relaxing, fun, cute little game that has me wanting to play more and more!
7 hours in and im really enjoying it! if you're into cozy space decorating games with some mystery then give it a shot.

my soul got sucked up into the vacuum that is this game. I had so much fun being meticulous with every room to find the perfect arrangement, and the fact that there are still more on the side jobs to do, and furniture to find is so pleasing. The satisfaction of Unpacking with more depth and engagement and whimsy. Genuinely a must play, I can only hope the devs are cooking up some future updates.
Had fun exploring the town and seeing all the little details in odd places. Would love to be able to adopt the cats in the game but overall a great game to play.

My first ever cozy relaxing game and it's really awesome. Gameplay is so much fun and it keeps you going for more and more! Highly Recommended!

I bought this game because I love cozy organization/ decorating games. Boy did this not dissapoint, and I love the art, the characters and the mystery of what is supposedly happening in the little town.

Great game, super cute, had a blast for 10h.
The story for all characters is carefully thought... Maybe not the main story but tbh I never cared about it.
100% recommend buy sale or not.
It's a small game that feels complete, not the kind you can see there is still content missing or that got abort. That being said I absolutely cannot wait for update, and hope we'll get more nice small stories.

This game is a must-have for cozy game lovers and anyone who enjoys organization mechanics. The intriguing lore really grabs your attention and sets it apart from others in the genre. Even though the story is short, thereâ€™s still plenty to explore with its endless empty rooms and tons of decoration items to play around with. The art is gorgeous, and the gameplay feels super comfy, fun, and a little mysterious. Solid 10/10!!!!

I went in expecting to just organize and decorate, 3 hours later i've left with concern for my customers safety and am wondering if making potions in a strangers house is ethical?? 10/10 lots of fun can't wait to figure out whats happening and if the world is ending.
Nice and cozy game, intricate artstyle with abundance of items in every room. Nice and not too long main story, with the addition to make your own rooms and ideas aside from the story tasks!

I am a fan of organization games, so this one roped me in. You can be very creative in decorating, so it's nice to not be judged on how you'd decorate a cat lovers or a gym bro's home. There is a mystery behind the game, but it's not a huge pull for me. It's pretty easy to unlock, I'd say, but I won't spoil it.

Great game I finished in one go. Loved it!

The first cozy game i wanted to 100% complete. As many cozy games have things that are completely repeat the same thing over and over Whisper of the house has mystery, decorating, and good story line. Only thing i would change, !. let me rescue the kitties on the street (Yes I am the NPC person and cats) . Does it stop me from wanting to play? No and have recommend to other people who game.

So I previously left an angry negative review due to a bug I had that stopped me from being able to get the last missing achievement, in the flower shop there was a tree that needs to be placed next to the window and will start dancing, the first time playing I missed it and after going back to achievement hunting it didn't work, I restarted even and it didn't work. Today I tried to see if I missed anything and it actually worked now.

I have a one critic, since I missed it so easily and had to back to find it and still couldn't figure it out, there has to be some small in game hint in some levels, the potions guy was also hard to find since I didn't realize I had to use the camera, you should have a better indicator that it's important. Not expecting games to hold my hand but there needs to be something to alert the player to it, without having to guess.

Such a fun, easy, cozy little game. I love mindless, relaxing, decorating games and this perfectly fits that. But it also has purpose and a story, along with really cool puzzles and city lore. You can play this game just doing the design and bare minimum, or you can choose to delve deeper into the city's secrets. Only issue I have is I wish there were a customization option for the character, and I wish you could have more control over coloring certain items. But theses are small issues that I'm sure will eventually be put in regardless (or maybe I havent gotten to that point yet)

I absolutely LOVE this game, only complaint is its a bit short
very fun and cozy game. unexpected story but the sorting and decorating helps to put my mind at ease :)

I loooooove this game. I instantly sunk my teeth into this as soon as I installed it and I have to say the art style AND storyline are so fun, the only complaint I would have is I wish there was more!
Love this adorable and fun game. Wish there were more story missions! I am considering starting again just to enjoy it more.

I am impressed with the amount of detail there is top this game! There are so many decorations, orientations of each one and enough variety to please any decorator! Not only this but there are such cool secrets and easter-eggs to discover while playing and learning more about the characters. Highly recommend!
obsessed with this game, not only do I love the element of unpacking and decorating, I am really enjoying the subtle creepy/eerie undertones of the subplot. Its like solving a mystery!

If you like casual, creative, decorate-a-pixel-house style games (similar to unpacking) you'll love this! Gives a lot of freedom to be as creative as you want while also giving you lots to do. Lovely variety of places & items you unlock as you play through the story. I think its also an excellent price for the amount of playtime. Looking forward to coming back whenever I get that itch to organize cute stuff. Having lots of fun!

I love this game! I'm hoping they come out with more locations to decorate. The story is super cute! If you liked Unpacking you'll love this game <3 <3 <3

Oh wow, this game is everything I have been wanting and more since playing Unpacking! It's like Unpacking but even better! I am still working my way through the game, taking my time, and trying to get as much out of it as I can before it's over. Warning for those with ADHD: You will play this game for hours instead of doing anything else you should be doing around your own home. I sat down to play for 10 minutes before bed and ended up playing nearly 3 hours until I knew I would regret my alarm going off the next day and waking up for work. Great game play, fun world, and you can pet cats. I am already dreading the end of this one.
Its extremely cozy and relaxing, reminds me of unpacking but a bit different, if you enjoyed unpacking you're definitely enjoy this one!

This game gave me way more than I expected. I expected a cozy decorating game, and it's exactly that but with deeper stories and lore. The little surprises and darker twists are so intriguing. It's something new that I never thought I need from Unpacking-like games. Also the level of details that goes into the town and furniture designs are insane!

[spoiler] The seance room puzzle blew my mind. Easy and simple, but so satisfying to do.[/spoiler] 

Thank you for making such a fun game!

Little puzzles, a very different vibe, good variety in the tasks/requests... I just wish it were longer (though I think this will be a game I revisit often!)

11 hours in so far and I'm loving itttttt!

It has a really enjoyable storyline and I love the creative freedom you get with decorating the houses

Not very long, but I've played shorter for the same price. I would definitely say it's worth it, especially if you value more indie productions. Easy 100% with the guides up, fun art, fun sound design. Highly recommend if you're a fan of Unpacking- it's similar to that, but with a full town instead of just one person's life.
What a delightful game <3 I'm only mad I played it so fast! Hope the developers consider adding more content. I freakin loved every second of it.
Great game. its a lot like the game Unpacking. But u get to decorate a lot. I enjoyed the story line too. Fun. 8/10.

10/10 pleeaaaasse make more content, i just finished the game and i feel empty inside
Perfect game for fans of unpacking. I really hope more will be added to this game later on!!

such a cute and cozy game and i love that there's a even deeper story past that if you have the desire to discover it. love the character design and the music just an all around cozy enjoyable game <3

This game is very well made! The pixel art is amazing and the decorating mechanics are fun. The anomalies and weirdness in the town makes for a great story, even though it's a pretty short one. After finishing the story there's not much to do besides some quests posted in town so I'd say replay-ability is low.

Overall 7/10 for me. It's cozy, cute, and fun! I just wish there was more to do after finishing the main story.

An adorable game with little stories for each character you meet. Some are bittersweet but ultimately wholesome. The main story itself is about 7 hours long and you can continue playing after you finish the game.

Small and heartwarming game with nifty puzzles. Arranging own spaces is also fun with an abundance of different items from spooky to super cute and cozy ones. Pet the cats, grow the plants, dust the dust, bake that cake and just chill around. Perfect.

Now if only I was this productive in my real house.

SUCH A GOOD GAME!!! The only thing I'll say is that when the main story line ends it's a little underwhelming, but I'm hoping they'll add to the lore and that won't be where it ends off, because I'm INVESTED. Love the game mechanics too I personally would just like to be given more range when placing items I want on the ground or walls also to renovate more!

Such a magical, wholesome game! I really enjoyed the story and the freedom in designing and decorating. I'm excited for further updates as it was quite quick to finish but has lots of scope for continued play before any updates. Highly recommend if you like Unpacking and any other fun cosy games!

Love the game a lot, 
the story, the hidden puzzles, the way they make you clean, put together and put away furniture, the little extra rooms to decorate to your liking.
the loot boxes give you something new and you can get multiples from it, its fun to collect them all.
played for about 12 hours for the story, then another two for the achievement clean up i had to do.

I would recommend this game, placing all the items, figuring out which items have extra interactions or hints in the description when you hover over them are all good to draw players in. there are a few disappointments where you are told exactly where to put everything, but mostly you have free reign to place where you want. there are also empty rooms where you are tasked with setting things for a "theme" (sort of, having a brain fart on how to describe it properly), but unlike the unpacking rooms where you can sometimes struggle to find proper places for everything, you can get 100% without filling out the whole space. also it is rather easy to fillout complete item collections (you might see that as either good or bad depending on how much of a challenge you want in collecting stuff)

I adored this game! The music was awesome, the graphics are spot-on for a cozy indy game about cleaning, the spooks were so cute. Everything about this game was great, though some of the puzzles were challenging to find. That sticker challenge? Oof, had to look that one up. Lol 10/10

was begging for an expanded unpacking-- this is her! love this game to bits! so much fun and super customizable, i'm not even finished! the story is just a bonus for me so, not super invested or anything, i just love all of the cute pixel furniture and possibilities to decorate!

What attracted me to buy this game at first was the cute pixel graphic as I LOVE pixel art games so much. This game is giving Habbo and Unpacking vibes! I kind of miss my Habbo era when playing this!
At first, it was kind of boring but as I played more, there are more and more task/challenges to solve which made it more interesting. I particularly love it when I help neighbours to clean their houses and along the way, there are hidden stories/clues that can be discovered. IMO, that's the best part of this game.

Once I start playing it, it's kind of hard to stop because it can be addictive as well! 
So far, I enjoy it!
Absolutely adorable and cozy. I wish there were more gameplay and quests! But alas, such is life.

Open world unpacking + weird stuff happening + cozy vibes.
Winning combination in my opinion, loved this game since the demo came out.
Hopefully in the future the devs will publish more updates/DLCs? Definitely need more content.
Worth the money you spend though, take it easy, enjoy the ride and get comfy while you decorate houses and businesses with a twist! A tip... There's lots of """secrets""" so click everything and investigate everything!

I'M OBSESSED. Loooove the graphics and the hidden things all over the town. There are so many surprises! I'm taking my time with the game because I don't want it to end. There's just so many things to unlock and left to explore!!!!!

Really fun cozy game but like all of the best ones it's way too short :') 

Excited for any more content that will come out though.

honestly my game of the year for super cozy indie game. Very cleaverly designed visual and especially AUDIO wise. You can turn on the A/C and literally just have it as background noise... this game i insane.

I am addicted, I was waiting for this game and it certainly delivered! I didn't purchase it till a bit after release but xiao hong shu convinced me not to wait, I didn't want to be spoiled. I'm so excited for future updates. 

If you're looking for a pixel art decorating game this one offers just that, with a LOT of customization!

My gosh. I had this recommended in a gaming group and I was like well, I love this style, I love decorating and it's open decorating for the most part and running around the town. There's no stamina when you run. It's almost like unpacking pretty much. I love it. I will say if you play on steamdeck the words are small and if can be tricky but I figured it out. I definitely need more of this. My only problem is that it was way too short.
Sweet, soothing, and a wonderful way to chill. Fun and easy to play.

A cute game... Sometimes, finding the anomalies takes a bit of random clicking, but other than that I enjoyed it!  Very cute art style and a lot of furniture and decoration options, so it was really fun to deocrate the rooms!
amazing game!! super cozy, lovely artstyle, good music, wonderful characters and bonus points for all the mysteries!! just wish it was longer ;'(
fun interior design game like unpacking but with more lore and fun aspects! some bugs to it but doesn't mess with the fun at all

Honestly, for the amount of content and the time I have and will continue to invest in this, very worth the price. If you liked Unpacking then you'll love this game. 

My only complaint is the "story"...is a little hard to follow. I loved interacting with the NPC's stories; those were fun little tidbits of a life that I got to experience and make changes to, but the overall story? What is going on devs :)

So 9/10 for me. Maybe the story makes more sense in the original language or maybe I just missed so many social cues as to what was going on but it truly did not tie together for me. 

I also wish that when you talked to the NPCs they would have different replies about how you helped them. But it seems that most of the thought for the game went into the designing aspect which honestly, zero complaints there.

Fun pixel decorating game with storyline. Had a really good time looking around hidden trinkets and uncover the mystery of the town. I feel it's a little bit short but it's worth the price. thank you.

I thought this would just be a chill decorating game, but itâ€™s so much more. The deeper you look, the more little details and storytelling elements reveal themselves. The amount of thought and care put into tiny easter eggs, many of which most players might never even notice, is insane. If you play this, I highly recommend going for 100% completion just to uncover all the small secrets that end up feeling surprisingly grand.

Wicked cute game - both art and story wise. The mysteries and figuring out how/where to find them was a nice touch too. Good game to just sit down and vibe with when you're in a chill game mood.

This game really hits the sweet spot between organization and decorating! The plot was a fun twist I didn't expect with all of the secrets you can uncover. A couple of the quests even made me emotional! I like the variety of challenges as well. Some are unpacking and putting away items, and later, after you get more items, you progress to freestyle decoration.
Such a fun and interesting game and it looks like there is going to be more content at some point
Best game ever, its so addicting. First time playing this game, I hadn't realized I had been on for 4 hours despite the notices saying its time to take a break lol. 10/10 game tbh <3
BEST GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED. I am literally addicted to it. Honestly 10/10

Very fun, has the "stardew" feel but without the farming and inventory management, really enjoying it and love the discoveries and lots of steam achievements

If you loved unpacking but got so sad that it ended too quickly and just very limited, then this game is for you. It's a major "upgraded" version. I liked the game so much. My favorite was the sorting game play for a convenience store. Hopefully they add more of this into the game. You can play it with nothing in mind while still not feeling like a lonely game because there are interaction with cats and people. Plus the cars. The game still has a lot of potentials. There are still other side of the map that hopefully gets unlocked/built. I hope they won't stop with updating this game. I reached the game's end credits and still a lot of things that you can do after. The game is also generous with vouchers that you can buy for furniture and stuffs. I hope they won't get greedy with this. 

So far, these are only the few things I can think of that should be fixed/added:
- small items even some books, cds, are hard to put upright especially in a shelf's end and under drawer.
- some furniture are not able to rotate all the way. 
- i hope they open up all the store/buildings in the current map for more things to do. 
- no dashboard of your ongoing tasks or lists on the UI dashboard. 
- maybe they can remove the control buttons guide on the upper left and change it with something else handy.
Currently my favorite game. Incredibly polished and clearly made with a lot of love and care.

good game i enjoyed it. very similar to unpacking but with more content, i sure hope they update this game for more content as this game is very short :(

Absolutely love this game. The design is so cute. I love how much content there is and how interactive it is. Unpacking was one of my favorite things to play through and until this game, I had not found something similar that did it as well. I love the creative freedom with design. I also love the story. There are so many cute achievements. Overall, very happy with this game and I am looking forward to future content.
I typically don't enjoy these kind of games, but giving this one a chance because of the story and it has me hooked. Spooky but cozy at the same time!

sometimes lost on things to do and already wish there were more events and people mailing for help! haven't finished the game, so maybe I'm wrong, but the time travel?! should be featured more, in the demo it seemed like a huge thing and sad to not see it be a utilized aspect as much.

This game is the perfect balance between cozy and unsettling. 10/10. 
I am a gamer who needs an objective-driven story but doesn't want to compromise for creative freedom and independence. Whisper of the House blends the two perfectly: I can design my own house, gather all the collectibles, and still follow a dedicated story. 
I love how Whisper of the House's unassumingly medium-sized map has puzzles and hidden secrets everywhere. It has everything you could want in a game: easy-to-follow, deep lore, unique characters, and more.
Cute ass art style. Not only that but there are mystery boxes! They're fun, and decorating in this game is also fun! :D

Very cozy game, but a very interesting story to go along with.

Absolute cutie butt game, it's super cozy and ADDICTING. 10/10 would recommend.

This game scratched an itch in my head I didn't even know I had. I have never been so addicted to a game before in my life, and that says a lot from me who is addicted to games in general. I had so much fun exploring this town. I will say I NEED MORE. But thats not because the devs did not do an amazing job, but because I literally need to organize more shops. What a brilliant game, its so much more than just unpacking/organising, there are mysteries and puzzles and stories to uncover. The graphics are cute and the sound track is chill. 10/10.
Such a cute game! Reminds me of Unpacking but with a story line and quest objectives. Very relaxing Indie game, HIGHLY recommend! Can't wait for additional content!

I've been playing this game for a little over four hours now, and I feel like I'm just scratching the surface of this game. It's cute, there's a creepy mystery, and I get to organize and clean, hell yes! Awesome game!

Very cute, easy to pick up and just a little spooky. Doesn't require much from my PC so I can play it on my laptop, which I appreciate. The game does give you lots of tasks very quickly at the beginning but there doesn't seem to be consequences for taking your time or leave tasks to do until later.

Such a fun little game, If you love unpacking then you'd really like this. My only critique is that I wish they leant into the creepy/horror side a little more. Some of the stories felt unfinished or left me wanting more as the secrets in the very first house hooked me instantly.

Whispers of the House really impressed me! The graphics are beautiful and the small puzzles along with the individual stories of the residents kept me hooked. I especially love that you can set up multiple houses, thatâ€™s a big plus for me.

On release day, I was a bit disappointed that items couldnâ€™t be sorted beyond their main categories, but to my surprise, the developers patched this issue literally the next day! That quick response was such a positive surprise and shows how much care is going into the game.

Iâ€™m excited to see what more content might be added in the future, and I can definitely see myself playing it again as a breather between other, heavier titles. A wonderful game so far, and Iâ€™m looking forward to what comes next!
I went into this expecting it to be very similar to Unpacking, which it is, but the occult-scifi-mystery made this surpass Unpacking for me. Thoroughly recommend!

Very sweet game, takes the idea of Unpacking and really tests what you can do with this sort of environmental storytelling! I do agree with some reviews that the ending of the story is a little anticlimactic, but I will also say that it makes up for the short length and conclusion with several sections that really hit me in the feels. I wasn't expecting to tear up during some of these stages, and to me, that marks this game as being able to emotionally connect with the player in a way not many games can.

I've heard that past previews of the game were quite different to what the game is right now, so do bear that in mind when reading other reviews and such. I do want to mention for the devs that more keybind options would be really great, especially for controllers! I would very much like to separate the interact and rotate functions (which are currently both bound to the B button on on xbox controller). It would also be great to see more quality of life functions like being able to empty an entire container or immediately put items into storage in your own home, as it can be pretty time-consuming to manually pick up small items one by one and move them.

TLDR; Lovely storytelling with very special moments, even though the end falls a little flat. Could use some QOL updates, but otherwise, a fairly short cozy game.

This game is soooo fun. It has this undertone of spooky story, but also feels like unpacking's cousin lol? I haven't had a game grab my attention quite like this one in a bit:) It is truly refreshing and totally worth $15!! I def recommend

This game was an obsession for me. Those 13 hours played happened over 2 days. I was up until 3AM finishing it. It's cute. It's relaxing. It's cozy. It's mysterious. I liked the puzzles. I liked the cleaning and decorating (tho by the end I had way too many credits and too many houses for my puny brain to decorate before the end of the story). 
My only complaint is I wanted more, more rooms to decorate that weren't the board missions (I found those a bit confusing, I needed a way to recheck what the person I was designing for wanted), more mysteries to solve and puzzles to puzzle out. Which I think is a great problem to have honestly.
Highly recommend, very worth the price, you will enjoy. ;)

It's quite fun if you loved Unpacking. Similar premise, unpacking and organizing stuff. There's also some elements of fun horror stuff that makes things interesting. It could still improve in a lot of ways: the items could be named while you hover or click on them, sometimes you can rotate items 360 degrees, some items only 180, items can't be put down on the floor (temporarily, like in Unpacked), etc. It would be nice to be able to copy and save walls and flooring styles as well. Overall, still a fun but short game.

easy move and cozy 
this game was made for perfectionist and OCD gamer 
could recommend

A fantastic, fun game. Easy to put hours into.
As much as Im not an achievement hunter, Ive already almost got all of them. 

Highly recommend to anyone who wants a chill, house decorating style game that has a few mysteries here and there.

I first bought this because it reminded me of Unpacking. At first, the price felt a bit steep, but I wanted a home-decorating fix absolutely no regrets. Itâ€™s been worth it and then some.

There are tons of hidden interactions, little puzzles, and fun surprises tucked everywhere. You can rush the story in a few hours, but slowing down makes it far more rewarding. Iâ€™ve seen people say they finished in 3 hours, but they definitely missed content.

The game is very polished:
Smooth, intuitive controls
Clean UI
Relaxing soundtrack
A tutorial that actually helps
Iâ€™d easily call it an 8/10 if this is your genre. I played the demo months back, and the full release is even smoother and more refined though thereâ€™s still space for improvements in future updates.

What I loved most:
The bulletin board adds replay ability with extra rooms and decorating challenges.
The sound design seriously, the music creates the perfect cozy mood.
Exploring the map is always fun, whether itâ€™s looting bins, hopping between places, or petting cats.

Huge thanks to the developers for such a warm, comforting game Iâ€™ll be playing for many more hours decorating homes.
I just purchased this game today and so far I'm loving it. It's adorable and just what I was looking for to keep my mind occupied!

Got about 6 hours out of this game, the main storyline is very short but the gameplay is cozy enough for that to not be that big of a deal. Would've loved to have seen more involving the alchemist the the magic ties to the town! Overall very cutesy artstyle and great game to sit and relax with.

We finally have "more like Unpacking!" I love the combination of task-oriented quests, plus a series of creative spaces customizable with easily-collected decorations.

I've been waiting for the full release for a long time, and I wasn't disappointed. Genuinely charming and fun to play! The main story does only contain about 8-10 hrs of gameplay. However, the same can be said for House Flipper, which occupies a similar niche and has become one of my most-played/replayed games.

Easy recommendation for fans of goal-oriented organization like Unpacking, fans of sandbox-style decorating games like Tiny Glade or MakeRoom, and cozy gamers broadly.

I love it, I hope to see more from this game and/or this team in the future!

I love it. Reminds of all the old isometric room decorator games I devoured on GirlGamesdotcom as a kid in the late 2000s. Except better because there's actual secrets to discover in the rooms, so it's like those room decorator games mixed with the hidden clickables in old Humongous Entertainment games. This game understands that some of us WANT to individually organize eighty packets of differently flavored saltine crackers on the grocery store shelves. It's called *ENRICHMENT*. Let me ORGANIZE.
Very cute and sweet. Kept me engaged with the more mysterious elements, where games like Unpacking get repetetive and leave me bored after a while.

This cured the craving I had for extra "Unpacking" levels and more. This game is not only organising but also has a more creative mode where you can decorate freely. The art is really beautifully done and there is a lot of furniture to choose from. The only thing that kind of confused me is the abrupt ending of all storylines.
going into this i thought it would've been a game like unpacking and then i questing if it was a secret scary game

The last time I kept so up to date with so much excitement before a game release was probably Bear and Breakfast - I literally hopped on as soon as it dropped and didn't put it down until I'd finished - I'm still working on finishing up the achievements but game play wise this game is incredibly fun, it's like if stardew and unpacking had a baby. The game environment is interactive and engaging, there's a lot of room for creativity outside of the games mystery with multiple properties to decorate with a very large library of items to collect and the puzzles are challenging but not difficult. Although I know the game is new, I do hope there is more content added - it has such a comforting vibe it's a shame its such a short game, the story was fun but that too was very short winded but i'd imagine in future more depth will be added (or at least that's what im hoping). Overall super cute game, i'd definitely recommend to players looking for something to just delve into for a few hours!

A friend who knew I liked unpacking recommended this to me and wow! It really exceeded my expectations. At it's core it's a game about organizing and cleaning people's homes. Some jobs are very free creatively and some jobs you need to follow a specific idea for what the customer wants. I am about 3 hours into the game and I can't put it down. I get so sucked into the design aspect and normally games like this leave me bored after 30 minutes or so. I enjoy that each place you decorate has it's own secrets and unique aspects to the design. I do wish the game explained what to do a little better since I am still a little confused about the extra houses you get to decorate and what to do with vouchers but I am sure that will get figured out eventually.

What starts as a simple task of unpacking and arranging items in [i]Whisper of the House[/i] quickly unfolds into something much deeper. The core loop feels similar to [i]Unpacking[/i]â€”youâ€™re given a room and a set of belongings to organize. Sometimes there are specific requirements, and other times youâ€™re free to get creative and place things however you like.

What really sets it apart, though, are the stories woven into the gameplay. One moment youâ€™re helping a new neighbor move in, and the next youâ€™re uncovering strange, occult secrets hidden around town. The mix of wholesome slice-of-life with a touch of mystery makes it hard to stop playing. Additionally, it allows for an incredible amount of creativity, while still being a task driven game, unlike similar sandbox style games.

I love that you can decorate your own house too, unlocking new items as you go. Items can be rotated, recolored, and even interact with each otherâ€”like putting sheets on a bed or stacking plates neatly in the cupboard. Itâ€™s a small detail, but it makes everything feel more alive.

Itâ€™s incredibly cozy, oddly addicting, and I keep telling myself â€œjust one more roomâ€ before realizing Iâ€™ve been playing for hours. If you enjoyed [i]Unpacking[/i] or just want a relaxing decorating game with an engaging story, this one is absolutely worth it.
I won this in a giveaway and I'm so happy I did! Super cute game with so much more gameplay than I was expecting! Can't wait for more updates!

Super chill game! Move into a cute lil town full of mysteries, unpack, decorate, HOARD!!!

A mix of decorating, organizing and discovering. I enjoyed the game and was a great weekend obsession. I was pretty sad when I realized the game was over and i didn't get to complete a mission in each building on the map. And for that, maybe its a bit overpriced? But if all I have to complain about it that I want more content, I would say its a pretty sick game!

this game at its core is very similar to unpacking. while unpacking will always hold a special place in my heart, i feel like this game takes it step further. things that i love about this game, CATS, the various things that you can just learn through walking / interacting around town, no frustration of having "put things in the wrong place", the music and aesthetic of the game, and the lovely "gravity falls" mystery.

i loved the mini quests (within bigger quests) throughout the game and hoping to see maybe more story lines added to the game as i loved the interactive story telling through the different quest lines!
Ta tremendo!! unos graficos divinos y una jugabilidad muy buena, las historias son atrapantes.
So relaxing and cozy. Perfect blend between the mystery/puzzle of stardew and the relaxation and aesthetic of unpacking

so far i am really loving this game, it harbours so much creativity and you can just tell that it was made with passion. I have already cried and too say i'm immersed and addicted is an understatement.

I also love the details they've put into the game, where every room and item has a little something special if you're also creative enough to explore..If you love chill games with cozy stories and animation, then this game is for you! Can't wait for more as the game develops and grows <3 KUDOS GD STUDIOS!!!

Easily one of my top favourite games of all time.

Things I love about this game:
- The cute sounds every item make when I interact with them
- Soooo manyyy items to decorate with (bottles, makeup, food (you can even bake the bread?!), PLuSHIESSSs
- Gacha system for furniture (but you also go to the shop to buy specific items you want), genius
- YOU CAN GROW YOUR PLANTS (devs, ilysm)

The pixel art is so clean! It's both calming but also creepy too. My minor complaint is that there is random text that isn't english that pops up from time to time. My major compliant that that you do get a lot a furniture, but you can't change the colors of it, the story is only 6 hours long, and most areas are very strict and give you a set amount of things, and I cannot adopt the cat outside my office/house. 

I hope they add more stuff and features. If you wanna turn off your brain for 6 hours and zone out to the homely yet eerie vibes, then this is a great game. If you want something huge- this is not it, at least not yet <3
I love this game! cute art style and got some varieties to arrange other spaces, not only own space.
Very interactive, lots of cats, lots of collecting. Really close to a dream game for me. Waiting happily for the next update!

Absolutely delightful little game. The pixel artwork is beautiful and the background story is unique and fun without being overbearing. I do wish it was longer as I was having a very very good time and it only took me around 6 hours to 100% complete the game and get all of the achievements. Overall I would recommend it if you enjoy games like Unpacking where the game play is more important than the story. The story is there to just give a little reason for why you're doing what you're doing but it isn't totally necessary. I do still have more items to collect solely for the ability to go around and freely decorate the properties in the game I own but I don't know how much of an incentive that will be for me to go back into the game as the rooms are relatively small and it wouldn't take much time to do so. Solid 4/5 for me. No real reason to replay but I greatly enjoyed my play through and hope for either more content or a follow up game.

much akin to unpacking except with a surprising twist! there's tons of anomalies to catch (and fix). plus you get to place things where you want to (save for like two places iirc). the graphics are really pretty and the music is perfect. YOU CAN PET ALL THE KITTIES!! i have since completed the game and collected all the achievements! will absolutely play again in the future <3

Overall, this is a very enjoyable game. There are a lot of adorable furniture to choose from, letting you freely design and personalize your own room. The game also features many heartwarming stories.
What I really love is some light mystery and detective elements in the game, which make me want to explore the town even further.
The only thing that makes me sad is that the story feels a bit too short, and I was left wanting more after finishing it. I hope future updates bring larger maps or new areas, and more story content.

Pretty much unpacked but open-ish world, pixel graphics and more to it. So far the levels are exactly the same as they were in unpacking (I never finished that game so not 100% sure if it changed from just putting things in a room with a few that had to go in certain spots) but, there has been a couple different "challenges". So far there was one where you could decorate how you see fit, but with a few items that had to be included and another was a music shop that you had to place every items in the exact spot the game wanted you to put them. Then there are some that have you clean up the place as well.

There is a leveling system in place. Only thing I have been given was vouchers. You get them for completing the levels as well and are used for the games gotcha mechanics. You can also find some vouchers in bushes. There are 3 types of gotcha mechanics so far that I have came across. Food, decorations and furniture. It unlocks items for use in your house and for the levels where it allows you to decorate how you set fit.

I can definitely recommend if you are into these types of games.
the content and gameplay is so much more varied than i'd thought. depression buster
Love the art style.  Very relaxing game play which is exactly what I need after work.
Very fun decorating game. I only wish the sorting and search for the furniture were better. And PLEASE an indicator if an item is recolorable or not!

å¾ˆæœ‰æ„æ€ï¼Œæ”¶çº³ç±»åˆå¸¦ç€å‰§æƒ…ç±»ï¼Œå€¼å¾—æ¢ç´¢ï¼

Keep in mind, the game itself is very short. The story isn't deep but it has some interesting moments, the scavenger hunt is fun, though the payoff is a little weak.

What this game sets out to do though it does very well. As a dollhouse game it's very successful, I wish there was more more missions and buildings to play around with (not getting to go into the library, farm, lighthouse, or campervan was a bit of a let down) but I think it is overall really solid. I hope theres some updates in the future to add more furniture and missions. I will probably get a few more hours out of this decorating the houses you unlock and re-arranging some of the mission areas.
æµç¨‹8å°æ—¶å·¦å³å§ï¼Œè‡ªç”±åº¦æŒºé«˜çš„ï¼Œä½†è¿˜æ˜¯æ„Ÿè§‰å†…å®¹æœ‰ç‚¹å°‘å¸Œæœ›åç»­èƒ½æœ‰æ–°å®¶å…·

Such a charming game! Many have compared it to Unpacking, but I also found it more familiar to childhood social mmo's I grew up with, and like a gamified version of custom player rooms you could decorate yourself. I've regularly jumped between the various requests and my own houses to redecorate as I've earned more furniture, and love the variety you get from job to job with what the tasks require. The item descriptions and more mecab secrets have also kept putting a smile on my face for each new one I find!

The only critique I have so far is the controls. I was very excited from the demo that my control does work for play, and for the overall game it functions fine, but it does get pretty glitchy when trying to open up and navigate menues. I frequently have to tab in or out from the game, or click with the mouse for a bit, for the controller to work again. Outside of menues though it works great, and hasn't taken away from the bulk of the game, so I'd love to see this improved in the future!

It's everything I wanted out of Sims 4, taking away the parts I hated. 

I can decorate my house and other spaces, organize items (such a stim for me), character interactions are minimal but not flat (which I like), town is charming, map is easy to traverse (I laughed when a car pingponged away from me), no health or food meters to attend, just adorable pixel art. 

Some minor bugs encountered, but devs are actively working on them! Nothing that'll stop me from playing. Haven't finished yet - there's a surprising amount of content in this game! Lots of enjoyable puzzles and secrets. I was not expecting much going in since most games like this are cash grabs, but not this one!

There's clearly a lot of effort, time, and talent that went into the game! Highly recommend!

Literally gotten three of my friends into this game, absolutely obsessed. It's been SO long since I've been drawn into a game this strongly! Think unpacking but with more freedom and decorating. I love how relaxing it is and the fact that you have to work to unlock certain items. :D love, love looove!

Even though the game doesn't support Korean, its attractive dot graphics and interesting game progress made me buy it. 
There are so many advantages, but I hope there are a few more updates. 
1. Color adjustment of items that cannot be changed
2. More colors available
3. And more content
I think it's a game worth playing when you're bored. Highly recommended.

It's a cozy game with a touch of spook and supernatural. I like the design and the choice of furniture

I really enjoyed this game â€” it has such a chill vibe that makes it perfect for winding down. Thereâ€™s a nice bit of â€œMarie Kondo-ingâ€ to it, with the satisfaction of organizing and tidying things up. The story might be simple, but itâ€™s surprisingly interesting and kept me engaged.

That said, I do wish there was more content to explore, and it would be amazing if we could have pets in our houses. On the bright side, the fact that you can pet cats is such a wholesome touch â€” it instantly won me over.

Overall, itâ€™s a cozy and relaxing experience that Iâ€™d recommend to anyone looking for something light.

I played the demo and it was enough for me to want to purchase the full game. As many have said, if you liked Unpacking, you'll most probably like Whisper of the House, too. 

However, the game still feels a bit unpolished. The menu isn't as intuitive as it should be, and some effects feel like they should be softer, like sleeping (you click on sleep, and it's literally only a second or two of animation and the night has passed). So, some things feel slightly rushed and clunky. There are also several lines that aren't translated in English. 

If you're willing to overlook these small details, then I'm sure you'll enjoy playing Whisper of the House.

Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys cozy home-decorating games with adorable pixel art. Arranging the furniture is super fun and relaxing, and the story is surprisingly engagingâ€”with little unexpected twists that keep things exciting in a lighthearted way. Honestly, I just wish the game were longer, because I managed to finish the main storyline in only 2â€“3 days.

The only downside is that since itâ€™s a brand-new release, there are still quite a few minor bugs, and the user interface can feel a bit clunky. For example, thereâ€™s no clear category system for furniture or decorations within the same collection. Still, none of these issues really get in the way of enjoying the story or collecting achievements.

Huge fan of this game already! Super cute and a lot of fun as someone who enjoyed Unpacking.

Only con is the game is very short story wise at the moment, I finished it in about 6 hours though theres still plenty to do after! I hope it get fleshed out more as time goes on!

I am absolutely in love with every aspect of this game. The variety of different "house keeping" quests, the art style, the dark creepy main story, the chilled music. This is the perfect cosy game. While currently the game seems short, there are obviously plans to add more content as there are so many areas left to be unlocked. Looking forward to future updates and where the story goes.

this game is SO fun! i love the missions and side story lines. once i finished all the main missions and stopped getting daily mail, it gets a little confusing on what youre supposed to do, but still a great game. i would like a endless mode of sorts where you can do more of the missions of unpacking peoples houses rather than the free to decorate tasks. thats the most fun part was unpacking others homes from their boxes :)

Very charming and relaxing game. Kind of like Unpacking on crack with a sprinkle of House Flipper. There's an insane amount of pixel art assets that can be used to decorate (in total 1k? maybe more?). Many assets are also rotatable or even interactive. The story is surprisingly neat, but it does feel like there could be more. The main story is short and can be completed in 6-7h (more if you take your time), but the game also offers a somewhat open ended game loop -- it's possible to decorate (empty) rooms with assets (based on a random topic) but this only holds as far as one's creativity goes.

I love this game, absolutely obsessed. I hope they add more to the story (I binge play games). I definitely think this money was well spent and I would love to experience it again for the first time. :D

Great for anyone who played the game "Unpacking" or if you like unpacking/organizing/decorating games. There's also a story within the game which makes it all the more fun as you're playing - makes you keep wanting to find clues/secrets to unlock the rest of the story or learn more.

These developers took a concept of games like Unpacking and made it into something super special! My only issue with it is I know I'll want to drop 200+ hours on it and I feel like I'll be done with a majority of the content soon. Seriously worth it! Open world, customizable, great story, plenty of achievements, hidden lore, and literally hundreds if not 1,000+ items. It has everything you could want in a cozy game. 

I would love to see more updates and content, and if I'm lucky some character customization. I will be spreading the word, thank you for all your hard work, developers!

This game is a cosy dream come true! One of the best parts in cosy games is decorating your home and this takes that and multiplies it to a town! This game takes organising, cleaning, decorating, and uncovering a mystery and wraps it up in one beautifully illustrated adventure. The pixel vibes are perfect for the gameplay, and you can spend hours getting lost in all the different homes and rooms you can make. 

The only con is that the game is short. I would love a few more homes and missions to make the story feel more complete, but I would say that's a compliment to how enjoyable the game is.

I've played the demo a few months back and I couldn't wait for the full game to come out. At the time there was no solid release date, so I was bummed and to my surprise I woke up one morning and saw the game came out so I bought it immediately. I am only 4 hours in but it is so cute and I do not want to stop playing. I'm really hoping that there will be tons of content and that it's not just a short game.

And all of sudden, I found myself enjoying searching trash bags on the street...stealing milk bottles in the front yards.... and cleaning, organising, endless things to do that I could keep concentrating on... Totally worth the price!!!!! Fully highly strongly recommend!!!!

Cozy relaxing game
with little exploring and puzzle
many items for customization your home (there are more) and all rooms
(ktichen, bathroom, livingroom, basement, terrace, shops, and other)
very nice pixelart game
i need more games like this :)

ps: all achievemnts unlocked :) yay!

This game is perfect for cozy gamers. I have really bad anxiety and this game just melts it away. The mystery element is fun and exciting. the organizing appeals because its not always strict on placement but there is a bit so things don't get boring. Can't wait to finish it but also never want it to end.

I love this game, no other design / packing game comes close. It is cute, gives enough freedom to decorate how you want and collect what you love most. I barely touched the surface of what this game has to offer yet, but there is still so much to do and discover and look forward to playing it every day!

As someone who doesnâ€™t like farming sims and always looks for cozy games that donâ€™t have that theme but canâ€™t find many of them, Whisper of the House ticked a lot of my boxes and was thoroughly an enjoyable experience. Really hoping this game continues to get more updates and features as it has a lot of potential for further development!

Worth to buy, worth a good review => crafted with love, it surprised me by its gentle warm touch - an incredible relaxing game that let you dream. It's so rare nowodays. In the first 3s of playing you see that there has been hard work to create it. I recommand it!
This is the perfect game, exactly the kind I love so much! Exploration, looting, decorating, hidden secrets, and so much more! I hope this gets dlc or they make more like this!

This game is everything a "clutter" addict wants. I found out about this game a month ago and was feining for it ever since I laid eyes on it. I was nervous that it would be lacking the "secret" part of the game, but I think it does a great job with keeping you intrigued. I love it. I have posted about this and shared my love for it to everyone. Definitely buy this game. You will not regret it!

What a fun game. If you liked unpacking, you will really like this. I love that there's some story that connects everything and also a little bit of mystery. That was unexpected but added a lot to the narrative. Everything about this game is adorable and you can play it as meticulous as you want or as brain dead as you want, the guides are really helpful in completing levels and the story. If I did have to give critique, I wish all items could be color customised and not just certain items. I think that would really elevate the decorating experience with more options. That and I wish we could engage with the NPC's more. Aside from that I really enjoyed this game and I'm looking forward to completing it
Really sweet chill little game. Pixel art is really cute too! I just wish there was more content to play through <3

Steam always teases me with their cool 8 bit sales banners and event/holiday, thinking the banner is form a game they are featuring in the sales. this game has more than satisfied that want for cozy little 8 bit play along with a dopamine chaser around ever turn.

This is a very cute and cozy. If you like Unpacking then I highly recommend this game! I have been having so much fun and it is so easy to move around, clean and decorate. There are so many cute items and I'm having a lot of find finding all the little hidden secrets. I can't wait to see what future updates or DLC bring to this game!

Like Unpacking but more! The story is really cute but I think itâ€™s too short for the price. 

The graphics, gameplay are cozy and warm and can take you hours on end to just decorate but itâ€™s very repetitive in terms of â€œroom decoratingâ€ and you donâ€™t have to do much to get the full vouchers. 

I like this game a lot donâ€™t get me wrong. It itched the decorating part and interactive part that animal crossing: happy home lacked. 

The gameplay is creative and fun but the story was just way too short for my taste. I didnâ€™t even realize I was done until I saw there wasnâ€™t much abnormalities left on the museum. 

I would recommend this when itâ€™s more on sale because the story only had taken me roughly 10 hours in the expand of 2 days to finish. 

If you adore decorating, cozy and small interactions within a game- I do recommend you try this game!

Cute and cozy. It's like Unpacking meets Animal Crossing Happy Home Designer/Paradise. I did not play the demo, but I had this game wishlisted for a long time and it has exceeded my expectations. There are lots of secrets, optional puzzles, areas to explore, and I don't feel constrained to only do quests. I think I only ran into 1 bug the entire time I've played which is the search feature not working correctly for storage, but it's been reported (and there is a workaround). The devs also already put out a patch for the game at launch.

I highly recommend this game!

My only qualm:
- Home designs can feel limited due to lack of matching item sets, lack of color customizing of some items/walls/floors (some can be customized, but not all) but that's really it. 

I'd be so excited if the devs continued to update the game and add more features, items, quests, etc. but it really does feel "complete".

If Unpacked and the ACNH DLC had a baby this game would be it! There is such an amazing attention to detail that makes the world feel so alive, and all of the items have such an incredible amount of love and personality poured into them. I adore the fun puzzles that are sprinkled throughout the game, each one completely different from the next. Although there are many games this one can be compared to, it truly is unique and spectacular in its own right. I can't wait to see more people enjoy this game as much as I have!

Super super recommend! Unpacking, house flipper, camper van, all these cozy games in one unique package with intriguing characters and events. As well as wayyy more bang for your buck. If this game cost more, I would have paid more no question. 
I think at 2 hours I've done 4 houses, sorted through A LOT of garbage and pet at least 3 cats, if you want like an actual content review.

At least 9-10 hours of fun house decorating, item collecting, and mystery solving! There's many secrets and achievements as well as extra rooms to decorate after the main story. I love the aesthetic of the game and all the cute furniture. Also you can pet cat. 10/10
A bit short but a really great creative game.

Cozy and gimmicky little game with a lovely artstyle, a nice variety of items and quest. 

Perfect for a laid back session of gaming and/or if you are a fan of this type of game.

I love this game, counted down until the release date. played the demo too many times...is there really too many? nope. 

It seems like a small cozy creative organization or interior design game, but the more you do the more interactive it gets. Mysteries around every corner, characters you want to learn more about, stories that intrigue [spoiler] My favorite thing to do is visit the well...she is so cute! [/spoiler]

There are interactive items you come across making the world feel more alive and more immersive. With all of the different quests and items to collect I find it fully re-playable over and over. 

I highly recommend this game!!

I'm not completely done yet, but so far I have to say I am very impressed. It starts out cozy at first and the mystery element develops slowly, which isn't an issue for me personally, in fact I prefer it even. The actual tasks are all a little different from each other, sometimes you can design a room however you want, sometimes you just have to place objects in their designated spots or it's a mix of both, so the gameplay doesn't get boring. The rooms also each have their own little secrets and mechanics to discover. The gacha mechanic for items is a bit of a weird choice in my opinion, but also not really an issue since you can obtain more than enough currency. The town itself is very beautiful and atmospheric, especially at night, I love that you can pet the cats! <3 The only thing I'd like is some sort of character customization, but I'm not a developer myself and not sure if that would work out with the graphics, if you can even see significant changes on the character model. But still I can only recommend the game!

Update: I've played through the entire game and played some more after some new items were added and I still love it! The fact that you can now change layouts and have more of your own homes to design is great and what I had wished for after my playthrough. The game leaves you just naturally wanting more and I do hope they release DLC for this game or something, I'd definitely be the first to buy it! Though one thing that bugs me, is that you can change the wallpaper in the starter home, but not in the apartment with the balcony for some reason? Please fix that!
