i loveeeeeeeee this game so much and the fact that it is a pixel game makes it soooo soo much better for me. i love games where i can just chill and decorate stuff. although i wish we can interact with the villagers more and theres character customization. but so far this game is good. ive been playing it since it came out i hope theres more contents coming soon! :D

I'm having such a blast that I bought this twice because I couldn't wait for my best friend to play it.

Arts is spectacular, and gameplay is fun. 

Unfortunately no full controller support: 
- any text field requires keyboard
- scroll bars need to be clicked and dragged instead of scrolled with right stick
- inventory management with a controller is so slow and mind nubbing that eventually you give up on it.

The game could also use a UI scale option, as a lot of the text is tiny. Other bugs have been reported already, so hopefully these issues are fixed in the future.

Overall pretty good game, but a bit pricy for what you get.

This game is great, I think it's lowering my stress levels. It's comforting, relaxing and oddly satisfying with some fun mysteries sprinkled in.

This game is soo great!! its so worth it, the story, the puzzles and just the relaxing gameplay!

EDIT:  i do really wish this game gets more content, if we remove like 2 hours of me being clumsy... its a really short game for the price..

I can't remember the last time I was this excited for a games full release, and wow did this game live up to the hype I'd given it in my head!
It's got everything; gacha item collecting [using in game money, not real money, put your wallet away], cats to pet, chaotic decorating, cats to pet, mysteries that only you (the housekeeper who has only just moved to the city) can solve? Uh. Shiny stars on the ground that give you free money!
Did I mention all the cats you can pet? Because ohmygod all. the. cats. you. can. pet.

So many fun little mysteries and puzzles to solve and I've just been so charmed by the art style and decorating (and then re-decorating) spaces that it makes the game feel infinite, even with its story to follow!

Definitely worth playing if you're a fan of decorating/unboxing games and enjoy a hint of mystery while you do!

Not finished yet but this deserves to be another indie classic an absolute delight! Pretty artstyle and very fun little quirks and details. 

I only wish there werenâ€™t so many lootbox mechanics with getting decoration for your own house and I do think it has more cleanup tasks than expected. Still very charming and very fun.

If you're like me and absolutely loved Unpacking, but wanted more and decorate your own place, then this is the game for you! I find myself getting addicted to this game, it has meant ignoring messages from friends... whoops...

I love this game! I wasn't expecting to be able to talk to anyone, or walk around the town and explore as much as I have. I love to decorate, and the fact that I have HUNDREDS of items to choose from is so awesome! 

I loved unpacking, but wanted to be able to use the tools and create my own spaces. This is that, with a cute world to go with it. Cannot recommend enough!

This game takes the satisfying gameplay of Unpacking and sets the player loose on an entire town. As a new organizer in the field of interior design, you are given requests throughout town to aid people who have empty space and stuff to fill it with. 

The art is absolutely adorable, the town is fun to explore, and there's SO MUCH CUTE PIXEL FURNITURE! :D While exploring town, there's litter to clean up, mysteries and treasures to find, and cats to pet! And you get to decorate your own little apartment! There's a good variety of requests, too, in both homes and businesses. The day/night shift adds a lot of dynamic elements to the town without hindering you as a player. 

So far, this feels like a great cozy game that keeps you busy without punishing you for going at your own pace. And did I say how cute the art is?? I know you can see it in the photos, but there's so many different furniture pieces to find!

I've been waiting for this game to come out for a long time. Playing the demo made me even more excited for its release. Whisper of the House did not disappoint! I haven't had so much fun playing a game in awhile. I love organizing and cleaning games and this game is the best out of all the others I've tried. There is so much to do and so many little details and secrets hidden within. The game loop is incredibly addicting and impossible to put down. Instantly a new favorite! :D
I love the art, the story, the concept, the gameplay, the potential, everythinggg! It's so relaxing to play and so satisfying. This is exactly what I wanted from Unpacking.

éå¸¸å¥½ç©ï¼ç”»é£å¯çˆ±ï¼Œè£…ä¿®æ”¶çº³ï¼Œæ¸…æ´æ•´ç†é›†å¤§æˆçš„æ¸¸æˆï¼Œæ•…äº‹å’Œè§£å¯†è¿˜æœ‰å°æˆå°±éƒ½å¾ˆæœ‰è¶£å‘³ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯å¯æƒœå¤ªçŸ­äº†ï¼Œä¸è¿‡èƒ½çœ‹å‡ºä½œè€…éå¸¸ç»†è‡´ï¼Œå¾ˆå¤šå¯äº¤äº’å®¶å…·å’Œäº‹ä»¶ï¼Œå¸Œæœ›è¿˜èƒ½æœ‰æ›´å¤šæ•…äº‹çº¿æ›´æ–°~

I was so excited for this release and it far exceeded my expectations! There are SO many secrets and collectibles to discover, and the story is surprisingly compelling for a cozy decorating game. The graphics are adorable and the music is so relaxing. I'm about done with story missions it seems, but I played straight through without really spending time decorating my own homes so I still have plenty of gameplay and collecting to get through! My only real gripe so far is that the storage is a bit annoying to navigate. The categories are too broad and need subcategories. For example: chairs, sofas, tables, shelves, beds, and other large furniture items are all in the same category and they're all jumbled up. I wish I could select a category just for seating, bedding, tables, etc. That being the only problem I have with it, the developers really knocked this one out of the park! I would love to see more levels added, whether that comes in the form of paid DLC or free updates- I'm on board!

I've had the release date for this one marked on my calendar since I played the demo, and it did not disappoint! 

It's SO much fun! The music's relaxing, the gameplay and graphics are cozy and cute, and overall it scratches the same itch that Unpacking did for organizing and decorating items, while also giving you crumbs to a strange and mysterious story that implies there's way more to this quaint town that meets the eye, reminding me of Bloomtown in the BEST of ways. It's been a great time so far, and I can't wait to finish and uncover the truth, but I'm far enough in I'm definitely going to be recommending it to my friends.

This game feels wonderful to play. The sheer amount of teeny-tiny little pixel furniture items to find and buy! Loved snuffling around the overworld and cleaning up little messes for vouchers, and finding the little secrets in some of the homes was really fun. I enjoyed that the game had you come back to some of the same levels with changes to give you a little bit of that Unpacking nostalgia, but this game goes way beyond that - there's much more variety and you even have your own home you can decorate. Some levels have you place items exactly like a sticker book, some have you organising certain items however you want, some just tell you to open up your own storage and decorate freestyle. Highly recommend!!

Love it so much, if you love unpacking this is a huge upgrade from that game.
I has cleaning, organising, story, and the most important one PETTING CATS!

Incredible cozy game. Similar vibe to "Unpacking" not the same though. Theres a bit of hidden lore scattered, stuff in the city you can find. The people asking for your help each have a distinct personality different from each other and it gets represented in every room! Then theres also the "free mode" In which there's no goal; just a simple room you can decorate to your liking. The music also helps with relaxing.
Overall a very relaxing experience; Definitely recommend!
This game is so cute, I'm having such a good relaxing time playing this and finding little secrets across the town.
actually such a fun and cozy game, highly recommended!!

Cute, charming and fun :) I don't have to also go into detail about how much the gameplay is like unpacking haha. I really love the "open city" aspect of the game, being able to run around in town and help decorate local places. There's a lot of good variety in the furniture too! I find it very charming and fun, had a lot of fun playing this, and will be having more fun continuing to decorate and organize :)
Unpacking in a better coat with more options, i have to say that this game is way more funnier, has a better storyline compared to Unpacking, so grab it while you can

Augh 10/10 game I was so excited for release. Like unpacking but with an actual story and a whole town AND sci-fi mysteries.

Got completely sucked into the game! beautiful pixel-art, and love the various ways you can interact with rooms, expect different layers to the game! played non stop for a couple of hours and def one of my fav cozy games now!
è¿˜æ²¡æœ‰é€šå…³ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å·²ç»è§‰å¾—æ˜¯éå¸¸å¥½ç©çš„æ¸¸æˆäº†ï¼æˆ¿é—´å’Œå®¶å…·çš„ç±»å‹éå¸¸ä¸°å¯Œï¼Œå„ç§é£æ ¼éƒ½æœ‰ï¼ŒåŸ‹åœ¨æ•´ç†è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­çš„å‰§æƒ…ä¹Ÿå¾ˆç”¨å¿ƒã€‚æ€»è€Œè¨€ä¹‹éå¸¸æ¨èï¼

I did quite enjoy the game! I don't actually care for decorating in games too much, so it might seems strange why I picked up this game, but I do enjoy organising, especially if I have a certain limited amount of items that just need to be placed in the correct spot, and this game did not disappoint. 
The story was quite nice, the puzzles challenging but not frustrating, placing the items was very satisfying and overall it was a lovely experience. I'm sure that for people who do enjoy decorating this game would be even more pleasant, as the story took maybe 3h to complete, but there is plenty to do after finishing the main campaign.
Didn't encounter any bugs and the performance (save for a few loading hiccups) was very good.

If Unpacking and House Flipper had a baby. Very cute and relaxing.

I. Loved. It!

Youre missing out if you love organizing and exploring and unexpected twists. Adorable and super fun game! cant wait for future updates

As someone who only played for the de-cluttering and organising parts of this game, it was done really well. Loved all the different styles and was very fun with all the freedom of choice it allows you during decorating. The town mysteries and the residents 'problems' didnt personally interest me, and without that interest the ending just felt confusing and underwhelming. With as big as the town was and all the different items to collect i was really hoping for more main quest progress and themed roomes. You can do custom room on your own but without main goals to work on i guess i finished the game too soon. Great cute fun little game, i just didnt realise how much mystery was involved and hoped for longer gameplay.

I did not love this as much as I thought I would. The achievements take 0 brain power to figure out. I lost interest in the story and I do think Unpacking does this better. Please wait until this game is on sale

Iam Inlove with this game. I will definitely replay this from a new save file and its that good <3...

More games like this please

Thank you GD Studio

picked it up because the art looks cool and I enjoyed the game Unpacking
it's getting a negative review at this time and I think I'm walking away for the foreseeable future because I am annoyed at the level for the music store, I don't play these kind of games because I want the game to tell me exactly where to place things, but if you're going to give me a glowing outline of the object, it is profoundly annoying for that glowing outline to not actually be where I can put the object but several pixels to the side. (because the object snaps into place when dropped) 

either tell me what to do correctly, or don't tell me what to do. 

also, this level might have been more reasonable as a tutorial, but putting a level where I have to follow put-thing-in-glowing-outline directions after I've already gotten the hang of doing things my way is awful. feels like being put at the kiddy table after making thanksgiving dinner.
There was a bug where i couldnt get past the first client level, so i refunded the game. Shame, because it seemed really fun, and i really liked Unpacking.

EDIT: This a very engaging puzzle game. The first quest is tonally a little off for me, but I enjoy that quite a bit of the puzzles have some unique mechanic to it.

I highly recommend this game if you love decorating and cute things sprinkled with a lil bit of dark mystery in the storyline.  It's not extremely grindy like stardew valley you can express your creativity really early on and there are styles for many different types of people. Not to mention you can endlessly play and redo rooms/shops to your hearts content which you will wanna do after progressing even more & unlocking more furniture. IT'S EXTREMELY SATISFYING U WILL SPEND HOURS DECORATING UR DREAM HOUSE/SHOPS LOVE love love it. ^o^

+ If you love cats.......they are sprinkled all over the map! And the loading screen transitions from cats to hearts to teddy bears like pls can this game get any better >_<

++ You won't be judged for digging in the trash like in stardew.

The game play experience is terrible! Many bugs prevent the game from running smoothly. Even after uninstalling and reinstalling, I still couldn't progressing.

Not recommended...
The art style is nice but the placing of furniture is just both boring and annoying. I enjoyed playing unpacking but not this game.
There are way too many tiny objects and not enough shelves and cabinets to place them. I also can't help but feeling unreasonable or a kind of unsatisfaction when placing the furniture. 
One thing is, the strange and secret events that happens during packing does make the game seems interesting, just that the unsatisfaction can't make me finish the game.

played 6 hours over 2 days and then bought for my friend (meaning I spent 40 local currency on this game within 2 days). So worth it if you enjoy unpacking or any cute decorating games. I've not finished the main story yet but I am also a little slow at this game haha
I loved unpacking and this game has that sort of aspect to it. I always adore pixel art games and it's just nice to sit back and organize rooms (:

I'm obsessed. There is a ton of delightfully fun content to chew through, and the fact that there was recently a patch/update to add more items is both promising and exciting. I'd love more story missions but there is plenty of fun to have with the daily "freestyle" types of missions.

I DESPERATELY need to talk about this game! Okay, first of all - I'm a huge fan of the game 'Unpacking' and any sort of organisational games similar to it, so when this game popped up I was immediately curious. 
This game does not disappoint; if you liked Unpacking, this game is exactly that X10000 - a huge map, tones of levels, so much customisation, a cleaning mechanic, super cosy music and a story that's definitely peaked my interest. I have no idea about who the devs are but, whoever you are: you cooked so hard with this game, please keep updating with new levels and new furniture items! 

ps. love the little spooky mystery, no clue where it's gonna lead but, I'm so into it.

This is a thoroughly cozy game! I loved every second. I love the pixel art style, the customisation and the curious anomalies to find! I had to look through a walkthrough to find them all, but with enough clicking and thorough investigation you wouldn't need to do so, and finding them randomly is so much fun. Took me a good 10-11 hours to finish over the course of a week, playing a few hours a day. Really hope they make more games like this as have been trying to find something to fill the Unpacking-sized hole in my gaming life and this definitely did the trick! 10/10

I was about to ask for a refund because I felt like this was just a another Unpacking reskin but then things took a weird turn and I'm definitely keeping this game. I MUST KNOW!

I had super high hopes for this game but it ended up being disappointing. IT IS similar to unpacking but the problem is that not enough of the game is like that. There is an over world tacked on for no reason, if the game was strictly just unpacking boxes and placing furniture it would have been amazing. 

Some of the levels are super fun like the alchemy lab but most are pretty boring. There is a lot less polish in placing items than unpacking, I can't quite put my finger on it but it just feels way clunkier placing everything. 

Plus the game is super short, I did pretty much everything besides decorating my house in around four hours. It is not worth the money imo, if it was $5 then yeah.

5/10

It's... fine. The "story" isn't particularly well written (even from a grammatical standpoint) and seeing people talk about it in the reviews I was kind of expecting more. Personally I found the placement of the smaller items to be very jiggly/clunky when trying to do it with a joystick on my steamdeck, which has made some levels frustrating. 

The ability to collect lots of different items in the overworld is cool if you're into some of the more sandbox-style room decoration, but unfortunately I'm not. I do like that there are different types of levels (cleaning, unpacking, shelf-stacking, and ones where customers want things in specific places) which helps to keep things from getting monotonous.

It kinda just made me want to play Unpacking again though.

Very addictive and compelling at the outset but quickly tapers off into not really knowing what to do apart from indulging one's collectomania. There doesn't really feel like there's any uniting story behind all the "strange events" in town, nor adequate motivation to keep playing after finishing the main requests (which were fewer in number than I expected). All that said I did pour 12 numbed-out hours into this before I felt like there was nothing left for me, which is pretty good value for the sale price.

Loved it a ton! Wished they had more houses/rooms to give me to organize/decorate! I liked when the rooms had a specific setting and the owner/character asked you for help organizing and placing their belongings around freely. The empty rooms and those rooms where the character specifically pointed you to where they wanted each furniture/item were ok but that mode was definitely my favorite. I also liked it so much that I got all achievements (I never do that) and one good thing I found out is that achievements are, well, achievable! compared to other games where there's always a few that are almost impossible to do. So that was a relief and a happy surprise!
The art and details of each item plus commentary was also delightful!!! 
I seriously Seriously loved this game.

Pretty solid. It is cozy and pretty unrestrictive when it comes to the amount of time you can spend on a room and what you do with your time. The pacing of the story is set by you.

On top of being visually appealing with a lot of customizability, the stories are pretty fun. The underlying mystery reeled me in. I could not stop playing.

Yeah, there are some things that could be improved, such as the minor issue of objects slightly disappearing when trying to place them on top of other objects, and there being a limited number of styles of furniture, but the overall experience was pretty enjoyable. I would recommend this as a comfy game with a touch of mystery.
incredibly cute!! music and visuals are both fantastic!
Love this so much! The music and the art style and the atmosphere relaxed me so much.

Unpacking with a twist. I'm not going to spoil the twist, it was genuinely exciting to discover all of the secrets while I played blind. Game's got about 6 hours of content, and more if you're into the solo decoration kind of thing.

I can't put this down. This has scratched an itch that I've been seeking for so long. It's so much more than a decorating game. It has adorable NPC's, a map to explore, and little things to find! Thank you for making this Mac compatible! Every detail is exquisite!

In response to some reviews - I think not being able to turn the rooms around 360Â° makes it better. Reminds me of the old Animal Crossing games, and Stardew Valley as well, as it is a pixel game. It has it's own unique charm and identity. Additionally, addressing how some of the items can't be turned all ways, I assume it's because most of them are interactive and have to be front facing out. Neither of these are anything I feel the need to nitpick about, as the game is incredibly generous with how many items they have available! It's phenomenal, down to the tiniest little items to make things look lived in!

PS- the music is so awesome and relaxing!

A lot of shifting things around to suit any organizers little heart as well as mysteries to solve. All in what seems llike 8bit LOL FUN

This is one of the best home decorating games I've played in a good while, I love the art style, the interactive items, the ability to do extra rooms and multiple homes, even the little sprinkling of spooky. I couldn't recommend this more, especially as the devs are looking to add more to an already great game.

I don't think I can think of something I wasn't happy with, maybe the length of the story or the limited number of interactive items. Even then, that's more of a want than a need.

Overall, amazing, fun and cozy. It's great to veg out and just do a room for a bit.
This definitely is scratching the Unpacking itch I've had! It's cozy and cute and if you are able to, try and avoid spoilers. This has been such a great way to destress at the end of the day <3

If you're someone who grew up creating little pixel rooms back in the 2000s on Mini-Room Maker, it's highly likely this will be something you'll enjoy. A lot of creative ways to create rooms with the amount of items provided. I do wish however, that there was more cool-colored items, the game has quite a bit of orange, yellow and red.

Whisper of the House: 8/10
Completion Time: 12 Hours (Completionist)
â€¢
Help the residents of Whisper Town organize and decorate their homes & businesses, but be warnedâ€¦something unusual is going on hereâ€¦
â€¢
Welcome to Whisper Town! You have been invited to become the townâ€™s housekeeper. You will take various jobs helping people unpack in their new homes, organize their businesses, clean up abandoned areas, etc. all while learning their stories and uncovering something mysterious happening within the town. Youâ€™ve probably heard Whisper of the House being compared to the game â€œUnpackingâ€. Although I agree to some extent, I think that Whisper of the House offers so much more both in terms of gameplay and story. 
â€¢
Youâ€™ll enter each house/business and begin unpacking one item at a time. How you organize and decorate those areas is completely up to you. However, youâ€™ll have to complete the goals of each area - that might be making sure the space has been completely cleaned, or certain items align with certain spots, etc. Youâ€™ll also solve puzzles to unlock secret rooms or find a rare flower. Whisper of the House offers a variety of things to do, so you never feel bored. There is a linear story to uncover, but after the credits roll, youâ€™ll be able to maintain your role within the town and return to decorating until your heartâ€™s content. 
â€¢
I really enjoyed my time playing this game, however, there are a couple of reasons it didnâ€™t get a perfect score. The biggest reason was the ending. The entire game you are uncovering cursed objects and being threatened with creepy notes, but the ending didnâ€™t match that vibe at all. I was hoping for some big plot twist and it just fell flat. The second reason was that there was a lack of direction. Three areas stick out to me in particular, Lunaâ€™s house, the construction crane, and the Graveyard (I wonâ€™t go into further detail to avoid spoilers). Two of those areas directly impacted the advancement of the story, so not being able to figure out what I was missing became a little frustrating. I did have to resort to their Discord for some assistance. 
â€¢
Despite those couple of things, I absolutely loved this game and highly recommend it. If youâ€™d like to watch me play it or help in finding some achievements, I have the entire gameplay posted on my YouTube channel (@SwankyHoneybee).

Recommended for Non-Cozy Players as well. Not only does it has Secrets and Story, i just love that it actually tells you things you could do. You have actual "Quests" which for those kind of things where you decorate your room is usually not that common. And i'm not one of those Sims players that like to create things for no reason, i sadly need that small part of "hey can you help me move in" or "redecorate the house, a friend is joining me".

You also have a whole town to explore and walk around and furnitures to collect that you can freely place in your homes, which is more of the Sims direction i would say where you are free to do whatever you want to do.

So if you not the biggest creator and creative guy, i still recommend this one above a lot of others simply because it features the quests, town to explore and so much more. Also it is freaking 15â‚¬ max, that's a steal, just sayin not only for all the coding necessary to make it work so smooth but also for all the pixelart that comes with it.

[h2]A Cosy, Curious Town[/h2]

Whisper of the House is a dream if you love tidying, decorating, and discovering little secrets. You help townsfolk move, clean, and organise their homes and shops, all while uncovering hidden stories. The town has quirky characters, interactive objects, and plenty of tiny mysteries tucked away in every corner.

With over 1,800 items and full creative freedom, you can decorate exactly how you want. Lamps, TVs, and even bakery ovens all react when you interact with them, making every room feel alive. You can take your time, follow quests, or just decorate your own space. The pixel art is gorgeous, soft on the eyes, and paired with calm, non-intrusive music that really sets the mood. You can walk around, interact with characters, and discover all sorts of playful easter eggs. 

Compared to Unpacking, this game adds side quests, gacha furniture, and lots of interaction. Itâ€™s soothing and full of surprisesâ€”truly everything Unpacking could have been, and then some... There are even a few eerie secrets that leave you wondering what lies beneath this wholesome town.

[h3]Gameplay[/h3]
You take on the role of a moving assistant, cleaner, and home organizer, accompanied by a cute robot. Together, you help townspeople with tasks like moving into and settling down in their new homes or shopsâ€”this includes organizing spaces, decorating (you can arrange furniture however you like, giving you full creative freedom with no time limits; take as much time as you want!), and providing cleaning services to tidy up their messy residences and sort their belongings.

Nearly every item in the game includes an explanation, helping you gain a deeper understanding of your clientsâ€™ personal stuff. The game also features a wide variety of furniture, many with interactive surprises: you can turn on lamps, twist water taps, switch on the TV, hear a clang when moving a glass bottle, bake bread in a bakery, and moreâ€”there are plenty of little details waiting for you to find out!

Currently, the game offers over 1,800 pieces of items including food, carpets, furniture items, and utensils, 15+ story chapters, and 18 missions across different themes. Beyond designing residential homes, youâ€™ll also help clients with commercial spaces like bakeries, convenience stores, workshops, and music storesâ€”all set across more than 10 unique house layouts. Additionally, there are mysterious elements for you to uncover, solve, and collect.

In this lovely town, youâ€™ll also meet 30 unique, charming townsfolk, each with their own stories and personalities. By completing tasks for them after you received a letter of request from them, youâ€™ll build connections that may unlock some hidden mysteries. Keep an eye out for mysterious cracks in some residentsâ€™ homesâ€”these lead to secret mystery rooms! Once youâ€™re satisfied with your design work, you can show it off using the Showroom Mode (which includes photo filters) to take pictures of your creations and and finalize your job. You can also revisit clientsâ€™ homes anytime to interact with them or redecorate to your heartâ€™s content. Whatâ€™s more, your clients sometimes send gifts to your homeâ€”donâ€™t forget to check them out!

When you are not on your job, you can explore the neighborhood where you live to find hidden items by rummage through trash bins around town. There are also various shops that sell blind boxes via a gacha system, allowing you to collect exclusive furniture pieces. You even have your own house to redecorateâ€”use the items you have collected to create your dream home, adding a sandbox element to the game. The town feels alive with dynamic weather: sunny days, rain, and snow. You can also take a break by sitting on benches around town to relax and enjoy the scenery.

Whisper of the House delivers a fun, cozy, and therapeutic experience centered on cleaning, organizing, and decorating homes and shopsâ€”all while uncovering small mysteries. Whisper of the House is a cozy organisation and decorating simulation game with cute and vibrant pixel art. The game takes place in a nice little town near the ocean and filled with greeneries. Although, there seems to be some weird stuff happening here and there (ËµÂ Â¬á´—Â¬Ëµ).

I find the story pretty interesting, but I have to point out that the translation is not 100% the best. The english translation is at best at an understandable level, but some mistakes can still easily be noticed by fluent english speakers. Not to mention, I find the story tad bit short (took me 10hours to 100% the game, and that includes me exploring every corner and taking a lot of time trying to decorate my own home). I hope it's because they just released not long ago, so they're still working on expanding the story or some sort.

That's honestly some of the cons I've noticed. Personally I don't mind it much because the decorating aspect of the game remains wide and flexible to the players (except certain areas as part of the story). Moreover, the OSTs in this game is very relaxing, making my playtime fairly enjoyable à´¦àµà´¦à´¿ Ë‰ÍˆÌ€ê’³Ë‰ÍˆÌ )âœ§. I'd give this game an 8/10 for now until we get more potential updates (very hopeful here!).

Also, it really scratched that itch of wanting "more" from the Unpacking game (yes, they are very similar! so, do get this game if you enjoyed Unpacking very much).

PS: I played the game on my Steam Deck and personally, I think it runs fairly well. Although, please do take note that it is not 100% compatible, so there are certain issues such as needing to use the touch screen from time to time and also the text being too small in certain areas. I have to admit the game is definitely better on PC since it's more point and clicky rather than a console game, but I'm lazy and I prefer to play on my bed.

Whisper Town invites you into a cozy, heartwarming world where decorating, organizing, and uncovering little stories come together in a delightful experience. Taking on the role of the townâ€™s versatile housekeeper, youâ€™ll dive into a variety of charming and quirky tasks. From moving into new homes and tidying up cluttered spaces to setting up fresh shops, sorting through cherished keepsakes, and even tracking down elusive cats, every task offers a sense of purpose and reward. Completing these jobs grants you new furniture and decorative items, giving you the freedom to create a space that truly reflects your style and personality.

As you help the townsfolk bring order to their lives, youâ€™ll begin to notice that your efforts do more than just tidy roomsâ€”they gently influence the lives and stories of the residents around you. Beneath the surface of this quaint town lies a collection of unusual secrets waiting to be uncovered. Every item you place, every corner you clean, reveals traces of the people who live there. The small detailsâ€”a dusty letter, a carefully placed teacup, a plant resting by the windowâ€”each holds a quiet story just waiting to be discovered. Yet, Whisper Town isnâ€™t just about neatness; itâ€™s a playful place too. You might find yourself tinkering with a vintage gramophone, squeezing a rubber duck, or sneaking a tissue from a box, as if the town itself is softly calling out to you through these little gestures.

With over 1,800 pieces of furniture and more than ten unique home layouts, the game offers endless possibilities for personal expression. Whether you want to line a study wall with towering bookshelves, fill a sunlit greenhouse with flourishing plants, or stock a doomsday shelter full of supplies, the choices are yours to make. Customization goes beyond just placementâ€”wallpapers, flooring, and many pieces of furniture can be recolored or retextured to perfectly suit your mood. Dozens of items even feature unique sound effects, so as you explore and decorate, you donâ€™t just see your homeâ€”you hear it come alive. Tap the drums, snap a photo, or run the tap to fully immerse yourself in the environment.

Spending time with the townsfolk deepens your connections and builds friendships, enriching the warmth of everyday moments. Yet, beneath the cozy surface, Whisper Town holds mysteries that hint at something more enigmatic. A flickering numberâ€”42â€”hovers above the museum. A sudden rainbow streaks the sky. Rumors swirl about a â€œheart-stealing ghostâ€ haunting the old well, and strange tentacles seem to creep from cracks in the townâ€™s foundations. These eerie signs suggest that the townâ€™s story is far from ordinary, and perhaps the one destined to uncover its hidden truths is you. Whisper Town balances the charm of simple, heartfelt living with whispers of deeper mysteries, inviting you to explore, create, and unravel its secrets at your own pace.

Rating: 9/10

In an increasingly volatile market, within which consumers are expected to satiate executives' greed via microtransactions and expansions, Whisper of the House reminds gamers that pixels do not have to welcome waves of poverty. You will not find a limited edition 1978 refrigerator with an exclusive vinyl wrapping for $1544.99 here, but you can head over to the appliance store and buy yourself an adorable, stylized fridge in a variety of designs. You get multiple residences to decorate freely, as well as gently-guided tasks tidying and rebirthing your town's businesses and homes. You can return to redecorate depending on your current, real season to get seemingly endless time in this sci-fi dipped world. Whisper of the House drips cozy decor, calming atmosphere, and compassionate tales, and it will provide mental sanctuary when you need most. Click one button in your inventory to collect all within a room, breathe, and start again.

A couple notes I had after completing Whisper of the House:
- The description of the cane in the hospital being "usually used by old people" or something along that wording is inaccurate, as canes are used by disabled people. Disabled people can always utilize a mobility aid like a cane, but old people might end up using one eventually. 
- I want to be able to buy mobility aids and other accessibility devices when first starting out, like purchasing any other furniture piece or food item. I want wheelchairs, crutches, walkers, canes, changing tables, talk pads, ventilators, feeding tube equipment, etc. in my little whisper of a world. 
- If customizing your character is introduced, introduction of choosing your character being in a wheelchair or wearing casts/braces to traverse the town would be nice! When I see equipment such as grandpa's chair lift and the hospital's I.V. systems, I feel like I am less alien in my real life, like I don't need to hide my equipment and accommodations, and I feel empowered. But I dream of a future in which kiddos are gifted an affordable, accessible game and actually see themselves alive, welcome, and normal out with the rest of their community.
Gorgeous gem of a game, can see this totally blowing up in the near future.

Posting this for my wife since she played the game via Steam Family Sharing:

Going out of my way to post this review because thatâ€™s how much I loved this game!

It feels like the game Unpacking on steroids. Not only do you get to design rooms, but thereâ€™s also an active story to follow, a city to clean up, and even a small mystery to solve. I took my time and ended up playing for about 13 hours. Donâ€™t get me wrong, you could probably rush through it in under 2 hours, but the whole point of the game is to decorate, enjoy yourself, and not just fulfill requests as quickly as possible.

Itâ€™s the perfect balance: enough gameplay to stay relaxing without ever becoming boring. You can also keep playing after finishing the story, since the notification board updates with new design jobs every day.

PLEASE add more gameplay and objects in the future to give it more of a reason to play after finishing the story, because this really has the potential to become one of my most favorite games of all time.

When the creators of Unpacking said they had no intention of making a follow up game, I was stung. This game soothed that burn. It's relaxed, comforting, and highly interactive. I beat the main story and still have some little areas to work on, which I fully intend to do. I deeply enjoyed this game. With that being said, yes I'm going to be that person. It would have been nice to have a customized character. There really isn't a reason why we have to choose between two genders and one skin tone in 2025. It could have just been pick the body frame, pick the skin tone, pick the hair, and be done with it. That was my only hang up with this game. That, and a tiny bit more guidance could have been given.  However, this game easily paid for itself.

Super chill unpacking, room designing, organizing game with a hint of mystery! Love the pixel art and the PLANTS. Love the ability to revisit rooms to add or adjust as more furniture and wares are unlocked. Beautiful game to 100% and continue to customize.

LOVED this one, super cute furniture and little secrets I had fun discovering. I hope over time a bunch more content is added because I finished the main stuff pretty quickly. Totally worth your time, just a cute asf indie game.
very relaxing game, similar vibes to unpacking. Love the art, music, super relaxing

It's not a very long game, unless you like putting together rooms from a full set of furniture - which, you might. I prefer the "stages", where I have a set amount of things to put out, so the game is pretty much over for me now. But it was very charming - I liked it a lot. The puzzles weren't too hard, I didn't have to look anything up, and figuring out everything was very satisfying.
I would rec this game to fans of Unpacking - that's what I thought it might be like, and I was right!

This is like unpacking on steroids and I LOVED every second of it. SO many furniture options and the only limit is your imagination. I played it all the way through in 1 sitting because the game is addicting. 

I'd say its around 6-8 hours to finish, maybe 9 or 10 if you're trying to get all the achievements like I did. 

10/10 recommended: very peaceful, satisfying game play that includes intriguing story elements. 

I've been looking for this type of game for forever and it fulfilled my expectations and beyond. I want to find more similar indie games like this, or I hope the developers make a sequel!

I am in love with this game!! The graphics are wonderful, there's a fun story, and most importantly it is sooooo satisfying to place and arrange the items. I've tried a lot of games that tried to do the Unpacking thing and this is the first one that compares, and I think I might like it better! If you can spend hours and hours decorating and arranging, give it a try. <3

Love. So cute. A lil buggy here and there. The story feels like it was written by someone with ADHD who had too many ideas and tried to use them all and never finished any of them. The upside to that is a whole lot of easter eggs which is fun, but I would love if the devs would return to the story, flesh it out, and connect the loose ends.
Nice and relaxing. Added mysteries and storyline is a nice touch. It makes game not boring. Graphics are great. Very enjoyable experience overall.
Cute and cozy game. Great for anyone who likes arranging rooms. I'm not good at discovering the "secrets" part, so I've had to use someone's walkthrough for those.

Estou adorando o jogo! NÃ£o da vontade de parar, a unica coisa que falta Ã© ter em PORTUGUÃŠS, com certeza se tiver atualizaÃ§Ã£o com portuguÃªs vou passar muitas horas a mais jogando!
Really cozy, cute Stories. It's perfect for a relaxing evening!
Incredible game! I love everything about it, the gameplay, the story and storytelling elements, the amazing artstyle and the freedom to get creative! Support this game, you'll love it! c:

The game is cozy and cute, with a bit of a spooky factor. All the rooms have personalities that reflects the clients/characters which helps you learn about them even more. There are some bugs, but not too major. I do hope that there is more to the game tho. After collecting all the secret objects, there's really not much to do.

I loved playing Unpacking, so I figured I'd give this game a go. The art style isn't typically what I would play, but it has grown on me. It reminds me of the original Pokemon games. 
I really enjoy the fact that there is a mystery component built in. I love organizing/decorating and I love mysteries, so this game is a perfect mix of the two. 
I think the only negative I have at the moment are that you can't rotate the room to see it from all angles.
I haven't finished the game yet, but I would still highly recommend it to players who like games like Unpacking.
Absolut sÃ¼ÃŸes cozy Game mit ganz viel Liebe zum Detail. Es hat leichte Unpacking-Vibes, steht aber ganz fÃ¼r sich als eigenes Spiel.
can't explain enough how much i love this game, i can spend hours at a time playing and decorating

Really enjoyed the game. If you love Unpacking like me, you will love this. 

However, I definitely feel it needs more content in terms of main story missions. It took me 8 hours going as slow as possible and walking around cleaning up the town just because in order to fill time before I had completed every mission. I would also like more breadcrumbs about the mystery involved.

That being said, I loved it and very much hope the devs continue to add content.

Such a cute game, i really enjoyed it!! Loved the slight paranormal overtones. Some stories were really touching, like the old mafia boss lady and Fishie the painter. And the ending, of course.

There are a couple of things that could still be worked on:
- It would be nice to add some sort of character customization, like being able to change your hair or clothes.
- the sleeping function seems redundant. I figured out eventually that I can just never sleep and it won't have any consequences, so i was strolling 24/7 lmao
super cute game <3 had so much fun exploring and finding all the anomalies :3

hell yeah i'm in

I love this game! The organizing freedom is perfectly balanced, and the town you move into has SO MUCH PERSONALITY!!! I loved the demo, and now I love the game even more. I highly recommend buying this game!!

This game is great, I played the demo and loved it. The lore in this game is great and its better than Unpacking in my opinion. There is so many different types of furniture pieces to collect and use. I highly recommend this game, I played it for 5 hours straight and I'm still not done!

Sehr gutes Spiel, ich mag die vielen MÃ¶glichkeiten. Hoffe auf weitere Inhalts Updates. Es gibt ein paar zu wenige HÃ¤user und Saisonale Items wie fÃ¼r Halloween und Weihnachten fehlen so gut wie komplett. Aber das kann ja noch mit Updates kommen.
This game was amazing and so much better than I could have ever anticipated

I really, really liked this game. Once I started playing, I could not stop. I am sad to say I finished the main story today. There are a few pieces I still need to finish (collecting the mysterious items and the community board) I am hopeful that the devs will put out more content!
I can't even describe how much I love this game! Cosy, unpacking vibes with some lore hidden in there. One of the best games of the year!

I love it! I hope there will be updates in the future or even dlc worlds. Super satisfying sounds and the variety of gameplay keeps my ADHD in check. I would totally recommend this game for creative cozy gamers <3

First game in awhile where I played nonstop and was completely sucked into the game. Only downfall is I finished all the main tasks and letters within the first day and a half of starting, I WISH there was more letters and houses/store to clean and put together. I love the idea of this game and the style in which its created. I am hoping in the future there will be more letters, maybe more towns, and heck let us have our cat or pup!

I rarely leave reviews, but this game really was something!

The story is well written and rather long, there's atleast 8-10 hours worth of story gameplay, and the rest can be used to re-decorate or decorate your own houses, it's a very lovely game and it had a few surprises up it's sleeve! 

I highly recommend getting it, but please note that the story doesn't last forever, and to truly enjoy it try take it at a slower pace, instead of cramming through the entire story in 1-2 days like I did.

It does feel a bit lacking in some areas, such as options when it comes to decorating your own home, interacting with people and so forth, but nothing too limiting. 

I do also wish you were able to fully customize your character, rather than having to pick between a blonde boy or a black haired girl, and being able to actually own a pet, after seeing so many of them in the game.

It's definitely a good game for those who want to sit back and relax and just organize things though!

Relaxing. Decorate places + a bit of mystery. I wish the item list had better filters to easier find what you need, though.

I can't stop playing. You can tell this is a passion project cause there is so much to discover! I was in for the organizing but stayed for the innovative puzzles!!! It's soooo so fun and the lil gacha for funiture makes it a 10/10!!!
Cute little game. If you liked Unpacking you will enjoy this one. It's an unpacking game with a mysterious plot and secrets that help uncover the game's lore. Def worth a try
Unique gameplay combining organization and fetch quests, with cute storyline, and an underlying mystery. I was pleasantly surprised by the depth.

I have been looking for a game exactly like this and I'm so happy. I am still at the beginning but there are threads of a storyline beyond the packing that you stumble upon, and I am really excited to figure it out.

This is a veeery fun and cute pixel art decoration game~ with a little bit of twists in the story. Highly recommend to anyone who enjoys decoration games: lots of little secrets and funny 'easter eggs'! 100/10 :D
This game is one of a kind! 10/10. Feels like coming come, cozy, amazing, creative, good-feeling. this game needs a bigger audience! <3

Awesome game!  I was a huge fan of unpacking and have been wanting something similar ever since, this game scratched that itch perfectly for me!  Super adorable pixel graphics, very chill to play but also engaging with the puzzles and hidden mysteries.
Like Unpacking but there are a ton of places to organize and decorate, mysterious going ons, townspeople, etc.

I just started playing this game and I am ABSOLUTELY in LOVE with it! If you enjoy games that involve interior design, a chill vibe and an interesting storyline, then this is for you! I would 100% recommend this for my fellow cozy gamers, you can tell that the devs really put their heart into this game <3
Saw DeepSpaceMatt play it on Youtube, immediately fell in love and bought it, the only reason I stopped playing to write this review is because it's 5am and I need to sleep.
this game is adorable and SO much fun. there's so many different types of furniture and styles and the customization is amazing. i'll probably end up playing at least 100 hours of this
This game is SO CUTE. Love decorating the homes as well as unlocking new decor for my own home. The mystery of the game adds so much more depth and excitement!

So, I've rolled credits on the main story.  I gotta say, I did enjoy my time, though I feel there's more mystery than explanations.  Now, that, for the most part, is NOT a bad thing.  I don't need everything explained.  I liked that some puzzles were present without you realizing they were there.  [spoiler] Shout out to the alchemy puzzles and knowing Ian was missing and the page of instructions. [/spoiler].

Though others, I'm fairly sure there is something to do I'm just not sure where to look for the answers.  [spoiler] The runes you get in the graveyard have several of us stumped. [/spoiler].

I felt the music and sound were fine.  Music didn't overly stand out, in a good or bad way and the sounds were what you'd expect.

I'm a big fan of decorating/placing furniture and having some spookiness with that was rather fun.

The main story isn't a LONG game and I'ms sure you could speed run it if you felt like it (some jobs are longer than others, or easy to get away with little, mostly the bulletin board ones) so factor that in with your decide to purchase or not.

Like I said, I've rolled credits and there IS more to still do so I'm pretty satisfied.

Iâ€™ve gone through quite a few purchases and refunds this year, as most games just couldnâ€™t hold my attention past the first 10 minutes. I need something with clear goals to keep me engaged and enjoying the experience. Whisper of the House grabbed me instantly, it had me hooked within those first 10 minutes, and now Iâ€™m intentionally taking my time with it because I donâ€™t want it to end too quickly :â€™)

This is hands down my Cozy Game of the Year. Itâ€™s simple yet captivating, cozy but with just the right amount of haunting mystery as you try to piece everything together. I havenâ€™t finished it yet, but Iâ€™m so excited to uncover the truth behind the [spoiler] glitching items [/spoiler].

I really hope the developers continue to expand this gem. Itâ€™s so underrated, and more people deserve to enjoy it the way I have <3
